How many people templateYLabel[2] templateTitle[5] ? Having burst onto the scene in 2017 , templateTitle[5] has since become a templateTitle[6] phenomenon , amassing almost 250 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[2] across the globe as of March templateTitle[7] . How did templateTitle[5] become so big ? The reasons why templateTitle[5] has become such a global hit are clear to see . Not only is the game free , but it is also available on most gaming platforms . On top of this , the Battle Royale-style , in which up to 100 templateYLabel[2] fight it out at one time , mean that the re-playability of the game is infinite – each game is unique . The cartoon style of the game unsurprisingly lends itself more to the younger audience , with almost two-thirds of templateTitle[5] 's templateYLabel[2] aged between 18 and 24 . It also seems that it is not just the casual gamers that are attracted to this game as over templateTitle[7] percent of templateTitle[5] fans admitted to devoting over 16 hours to the game per week . Battle templateTitle[5] Battle Royale supremacy With the rise of games such as templateTitle[5] , the Battle Royale game mode has never been bigger . Revenue in the Battle Royale premium console segment amounted to 2.7 billion U.S. dollars in 2018 and was estimated to more than double to 6.9 billion U.S. dollars in templateTitle[7] . While templateTitle[5] is certainly staking its claim as the king of the Battle Royale games , it faces stiff competition from PlayerUnknown 's Battlegrounds which , unlike templateTitle[5] , is available on Steam . PUBG peaked at almost 3.24 templateYLabel[4] concurrent templateYLabel[2] on Steam at the beginning on 2018 and is still regularly peaking at over one templateYLabel[4] concurrent templateYLabel[2] . It seems that game developers are looking to cash in on this ever-growing market , so could new games such as Apex Legends also pose a threat to templateTitle[5] 's supremacy ?

Economy of the templateTitle[4] The templateTitle[4] has an open economy , which implies that the country is highly dependent on foreign activities , such as imports and exports . The country 's economic policies and regulations have allowed for the country to highly benefit from strong international relations , however have increased the chances of economic struggles that correspond with the economic situations in other countries as well . The templateTitle[4] is one of the main countries for foreign direct investments in Europe due to its strategic location , superior technological infrastructure as well as international business environment , a reputation that has all but grown more formidable over the years . Additionally , the country 's tourism industry makes up a rather large part of its GDP . Despite feeling the effects of the global financial crisis of 2008 as well as the Eurozone crisis , many aspects of the Dutch economy templateYLabel[2] highly prosperous , most notably with its low templateYLabel[0] rates . Unemployment within the country , in spite of a slight increase over the past several years , has remained relatively low in comparison many other European countries that were equally as affected by recession .

Trade balance of templateTitle[9] With the exception of 2009 , templateTitle[9] 's templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] was relatively stable year-over-year , however at a higher templateYLabel[2] prior to the financial crisis . In 2012 , templateTitle[9] reported a trade surplus , meaning that more goods and services combined were exported than imported . However , templateTitle[9] primarily profited from exporting goods , earning the majority of its revenues from its trade balance of goods , while the nation posted a trade deficit on its services , its highest loss recorded since 2003 . templateTitle[9] imports and exports its products and services primarily to neighboring countries or countries in Europe . templateTitle[9] 's most important trade partner is arguably China , potentially due to shared borders and strong political relations between the two nations . China is accountable for roughly 19.2 percent of all of templateTitle[9] 's imports , however only makes up roughly 8.3 percent of the country 's total exports . China has become an important import partner for many nations around the world as well as a country where larger companies can manufacture goods at a cheaper price .

Do the Dutch prefer to buy or to rent a house ? The templateTitle[7] had a slightly higher templateTitle[4] ownership rate ( the share of owner-occupied dwellings of all templateTitle[4] ) in 2017 than other countries in Northwestern Europe . 69 percent of all Dutch houses were owned , whereas this percentage was roughly 51 percent in Germany and 64 percent in France . This is an effect of past developments : the templateYLabel[1] to rent ratio ( the nominal purchase templateYLabel[1] of a house divided templateTitle[10] the annual rent of a similar place ) shows that for a long time it was relatively cheaper to buy a property in the templateTitle[7] than to rent one . Life for rent : mortgages in the templateTitle[7] Additionally , the templateTitle[7] has one of the highest mortgage debts among private individuals in Europe . In 2018 , total debt reached a value of approximately 714 billion templateYLabel[3] . This has a political background as the Dutch tax system allowed homeowners for many years to deduct interest paid on mortgage from pre-tax income for a maximum period of thirty years , essentially allowing for income support for homeowners . In the templateTitle[7] , this system is known as hypotheekrenteaftrek . Note that since 2014 , the Dutch government is slowly scaling this down with a planned acceleration from 2020 onwards .

In 2018 , the average templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] increased by about 1.68 percent templateYLabel[2] to the templateYLabel[4] templateXLabel[0] . templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[3] As explained briefly above , templateYLabel[0] is commonly defined as the level of prices for goods and services in a country 's economy over a certain time span . It increases when the total money supply of a country increases , causing the money 's value to decrease , and prices to increase again in turn . Nowadays the term `` templateYLabel[0] '' is used more or less synonymously with `` price level increase '' . Its opposite is deflation , which , in short , means a decrease of the price level . templateTitle[3] and its economy have been severely affected by the financial crisis of 2008 ( as can be seen above ) , when the real estate bubble imploded and caused the demand for goods and services to decrease and the unemployment templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] to increase dramatically . Even though deflation only occurred for one templateXLabel[0] in 2009 and the price level has been increasing since , templateTitle[3] 's economy still has a long way to go until full recovery . Apart from the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] and the unemployment templateYLabel[1] , gross domestic product / GDP growth in templateTitle[3] and the trade balance of goods in templateTitle[3] , i.e . the exports of goods minus the imports , templateYLabel[2] additional indicators of templateTitle[3] 's desolate condition during the economic crisis and its slow and difficult recovery ever since . Still , there is a silver lining for templateTitle[3] 's economy . All in all , things seems to be improving economically , albeit slowly ; many key indicators templateYLabel[2] starting to stabilize or even pick up again , while others still have some recovering to do .

Today , templateTitle[3] reports the highest templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] of all EU states . templateTitle[3] 's financial situation templateTitle[3] is a developed country with a high-income economy , whose primary industry revolves around tourism and shipping . Agriculture also plays an important role for the country 's economy , more specifically for the EU . templateTitle[3] had experienced large amounts of economic growth from the 1950s to the 1970s , however was economically devastated by the Great Recession in 2009 as well its own government debt crisis . Since the early 2000s , small increases in national debt were present within the Greek economy . These small increases turned into rather substantial surges between 2008 and 2011 , which resulted in a large amount of accumulated public debt . However , financial assistance from several countries around the world as well as stimulus packages from the EU were issued to templateTitle[3] , with the hopes of structural adjustments in the government and better decision making within the country in order to decrease national debt and increase productivity . The financial assistance helped stabilize templateTitle[3] 's debt over the past several years , however many countries are arguing just how useful this support is , mostly because templateTitle[3] has not made significant strides to improve its economy . As a result , consumers have become less optimistic about the possibility of a short term economic recovery in templateTitle[3] . Additionally , investors have remained hesitant on investing into the country , generally due to an increasing debt-to-GDP ratio , which is ranked atop all countries in the European Union . The so-called debt-to-GDP ratio is an important indicator of a country 's ability to pay back its debts without incurring further debt .

On the 6 May , 2012 , the incumbent French President was defeated by François Hollande , leader of the French Socialist Party . The new President vowed to develop and change the tax system of templateTitle[3] , announcing wide ranging economic policies in a bid to balance the templateYLabel[0] 's budget and right what he considered to be social wrongs . He pledged and supported the separation of lending and investment banks , as well as proposing sweeping changes to the French tax system . The introduction of the measure of capping tax loopholes at a maximum of ten thousand euros per templateXLabel[0] and questioning the solidarity tax on wealth , the annual direct wealth tax on those with assets in excess of 1.3 million , were also part of Hollande 's proposals . The President has also signalled his intention to implement an income tax rate of 75 percent on revenue earned above one million euros per templateXLabel[0] . In 2018 , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] global templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] amounted to about 500.34 templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] dollars.WalmartWal-Mart was founded in 1962 by Sam Walton when he and his brother James `` Bud '' Walton opened the first Wal-Mart Discount City in Rogers , Arkansas . Since then , Wal-Mart has grown to become the largest publicly-owned retail company in the templateTitle[4] . In the United States , the company includes Wal-Mart discount stores , Supercenters , Neighborhood Markets , and Sam templateTitle[1] Club warehouse membership clubs . The company also has many international operations . Wal-Mart is considered a variety store which focuses on low prices featuring apparel as well as hard goods , and has been committed to upholding their basic value of customer service.Beginning in the early 1990s , Wal-Mart went to great lengths to increase their market share . They introduced a full line of groceries into their stores , diversified their market by appealing to certain ethnic groups through bilingual advertisements , and took steps to promote the awareness of environmental issues.In 2017 , Wal-Mart operated over eleven thousand stores templateTitle[4] ; with 4,672 of those stores located in the United States alone . Even though Wal-Mart has been criticized for their low wages , they claim to templateYLabel[2] a lot of good for lower income households . Figures show that a family can save about one thousand templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] a templateXLabel[1] with their ability to cut prices on some products , such as toys , by thirty percent in order to stimulate more templateTitle[3] .

The statistic shows the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] ( templateYLabel[0] ) templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] from 1984 to 2017 , with projections up until templateTitle[10] . In 2017 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] was around 38,342.74 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] . For further information , see templateTitle[9] 's templateYLabel[0] . templateTitle[9] 's economy templateTitle[9] is the world 's second largest developed economy and a member of the Group of Eight , also known as G8 , which is comprised of the eight leading industrialized countries . Due to a weak financial sector , overregulation and a lack of demand , templateTitle[9] suffered substantially from the early 1990s until 2000 , a time referred to as ‘ 'The Lost Decade ' _ ' . templateTitle[9] 's economy is still slowly recovering from the country 's asset price bubble collapse ; however it continues to struggle to retain economic milestones achieved in the 1980s . templateTitle[9] 's response to the crash was to stimulate the economy , which in turn resulted in extensive amounts of debt that further increased into the 21st century , most notably after the 2008 financial crisis . Despite maintaining a surprisingly low unemployment rate , demand within the country remains inadequate , primarily because Japanese residents spend a rather small fraction of the money they earned from the workplace . Lower demand often has a direct effect on production , with companies seeing not enough profits to continue production at such a high rate . Based on the consumer confidence index , Japanese households found that their quality of life , income growth , employment and propensity to durable goods was below satisfactory standards , perhaps due to these households still experiencing the effects of the 1990s bubble crash .

While countries around the world struggled to templateYLabel[1] , let alone maintain a balanced economy , templateTitle[8] experienced a rather high percentage of templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[1] annually . The highest templateYLabel[0] of raindays was recorded in January of the same year , at 23.4 . Fourth quarter the wettest The wettest periods of the year tend to be the start and the end . In 2018 , the fourth quarter was the wettest , with an average of 452 mm of rainfall . November and December of the same year recorded the highest levels of templateTitle[0] rainfall after January , at 122.6 and 119.5 mm respectively . Regional weather Due to the templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] 's geographical location and landscape , weather conditions can vary greatly . Scotland has on average been the wettest country since 2010 . The majority of rainfall is concentrated in the Scottish Highlands , as precipitation often occurs in mountainous regions . As rainfall comes in from the Atlantic , it is the northern and western parts of the templateTitle[10] that are most susceptible to precipitation . This explains why England is the driest of all the regions , as templateTitle[3] deposits reduce as they move east .

In templateTitle[3] , 81.41 percent of the total templateYLabel[3] in templateTitle[2] lived in cities . templateTitle[2] 's rural exodus templateTitle[2] is one of the largest countries in the world regarding land area , second behind Russia . However , Canada´s inhabitants - like the majority of people around the world - prefer to live in cities where there templateYLabel[0] more possibilities to work and play . The country is part of North America , the most urbanized continent in the world . In 2014 , almost 82 percent of templateTitle[2] was urbanized , i.e . more than 80 percent of the Canadian templateYLabel[3] lived in cities . The manufacturing , finance , construction and trade that occurs within their boundaries help fuel the economy of templateYLabel[2] areas . While mining and oil and gas extraction compose a large templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[2] 's GDP and templateYLabel[0] often located in rural areas , they do not provide many jobs . Furthermore , agriculture , which was once of primary importance to the economy of rural areas , no longer plays the same role and makes up only a small templateYLabel[0] of both GDP and employment . In templateTitle[2] , people primarily migrate to the larger cities such as Toronto , Montreal , and Vancouver . As these cities and others attract young adults , this leaves less of them who stay and start families in rural areas . As a consequence , rural areas templateYLabel[0] experiencing a templateYLabel[3] decline as rural births do not compensate for templateYLabel[2] migration . Shrinking rural areas and growing templateYLabel[2] areas will place demands on both templateYLabel[2] and rural infrastructure in templateTitle[2] and around the world .

A large and efficient economy has helped templateTitle[9] attain a spot as a member of the G7 and G8 , as well as the European Union . After the Second World War , templateTitle[9] experienced a significant economic boost due to support from the ‘ 'Free World ' _ ' , which is a term used to identify non-communist countries during the Cold War . Real templateYLabel[0] is adjusted for price changes and is therefore regarded as a key indicator for economic templateYLabel[1] . templateTitle[8] 's real templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in 2018 was about 2.58 percent templateYLabel[3] to the templateYLabel[5] templateXLabel[0] . templateTitle[8] 's recovering economy templateTitle[8] maintains a relatively important role as a member of the European Union as well as the World Trade Organization . templateTitle[8] 's economy has been recognized as one of the most paramount in the world , however has been bogged down by multiple crisis 's over the past several years . The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] from 1994 to 2018 , with projections up until templateTitle[4] . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket . This product basket contains products and services , on which the average consumer spends money throughout the templateXLabel[0] . They include expenses for groceries , clothes , rent , power , telecommunications , recreational activities and raw materials ( e.g . gas , oil ) , as well as federal fees and taxes . With a population of around 143 million people and a re-awakened population growth since 2010 , templateTitle[3] has tried to establish itself as one the world 's largest economies and wealthiest nations and succeeded , being the sixth largest economy in the world today . The gross domestic product ( GDP ) increase in templateTitle[3] from 2009 to 2014 is also a good indicator of templateTitle[3] 's economic growth and strength . After the 1998 Russian financial crisis , several reforms were introduced to the Russian economy which allowed it to recover . Not only did the Russian economy experience a great boost but the quality of life in templateTitle[3] as well as the people 's satisfaction with the direction of the country has also improved . In comparison to the templateYLabel[4] templateXLabel[0] - with the exception of 2009 - , the Russian real gross domestic product growth templateYLabel[1] has increased over the past decade . The trade balance of goods has been experiencing a rapid increase since the beginning of the millennium , with the exceptions of 2007 and 2009 due to the global economic crisis . This allowed templateTitle[3] to export more goods than it imported . Google Play Games Google Play Games is an online templateTitle[2] service developed for Android . It allows users to develop their profiles , share their achievements , and see how they are faring on global leaderboards . Users with Google phones can also use the Google Play Store to download new templateTitle[2] templateTitle[4] – a total of almost 30 billion downloads were carried out in the store worldwide in 2018 , over three times the amount of Apple 's templateTitle[4] Store . The leading mobile templateTitle[2] templateTitle[4] on the Google Play Store worldwide is Candy Crush Saga . The legendary puzzle game generated revenue of over 67 templateYLabel[0] templateTitle[7] dollars in January templateTitle[8] . Given that the game is free to play , how has the game 's developer , King , made it into such a commercial success ? Sweet success of Candy Crush Saga First released templateTitle[10] King in April 2012 for Facebook , Candy Crush swiftly became a global phenomenon that took over smartphones around the world . Despite now being over seven years old , it still ranks very highly among other templateTitle[2] templateTitle[4] based on the revenue it generates . While the game itself is free to download and play , users are offered tempting in-game purchases in the form of power-ups to help them get past particularly tricky levels . It seems that many people have relied on this help as almost one billion templateTitle[7] dollars was spent templateTitle[10] players on the original Candy Crush Saga worldwide in 2018 . Over 500 templateYLabel[0] templateTitle[7] dollars was spent on the various spin-offs of the game , leaving it in no doubt that Candy Crush has been a sweet success for King .

In 2018 , templateTitle[9] 's real templateYLabel[0] grew by about templateTitle[10] percent templateYLabel[3] to the templateYLabel[5] templateXLabel[0] . templateTitle[9] 's economy templateTitle[9] , having not been dramatically affected by the 2002 South American crisis , has one of the strongest economies in the Americas behind the United States and Canada . By improving its macroeconomic rules and regulations , templateTitle[9] improved on many aspects of its economy , most notably inflation . Several goals that the government wanted accomplish were the improvement of infrastructure around the country as well as newer tax laws that would allow for higher income equality . templateTitle[9] is generally an export-oriented country , with the majority of export goods consisting of electronics , automobiles and agricultural goods . Exports over the past decade have seen continuous templateYLabel[1] , with the exception of 2009 . This increase in exports is largely due to an increasing number of free trade agreements with international countries , which essentially eliminate tariffs between member countries . However , templateTitle[9] imports more than they export , having recorded an annual trade deficit over the past decade . While most economics label this as a negative aspect , other economics believe that trade deficits templateYLabel[3] associated with positive economic developments .

The Triple-E vessel was built by South Korea 's Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine Engineering Company , one of the largest shipbuilding companies worldwide . The megahauler is just under 400 meters long and 59 meters wide , trailing only the OOCL Hong Kong in TEU capacity . Triple-E stands for `` economies of scale '' , `` energy efficient '' and `` environmentally improved '' . The templateYLabel[2] in the Triple-E class are regarded as the most efficient container templateYLabel[2] per twenty-foot equivalent of cargo . However , the building of such mega templateYLabel[2] comes at a risk as the container shipping-industry continues to suffer from overcapacity and weak global demand in times of rising trade tensions . About templateTitle[0] In terms of twenty-foot-equivalent units , Denmark 's templateTitle[0] Lines is the world 's largest container-shipping company . Twenty-foot equivalent units ( TEUs ) are the shipping industry 's standard unit of measure , denoting the capacity of a standard freight container .

In 2018 , the estimated templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] in templateTitle[3] amounted to approximately 1.33 billion people . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] in templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] currently has the second-largest templateTitle[1] in the world and is projected to overtake top-ranking China within forty years . Its residents comprise more than one-seventh of the entire world 's templateTitle[1] , and despite a slowly decreasing fertility rate ( which still exceeds the replacement rate and keeps the median age of the templateTitle[1] relatively low ) , an increasing life expectancy adds to an expanding templateTitle[1] . In comparison with other countries whose populations are decreasing , such as Japan , templateTitle[3] has a relatively small share of aged templateTitle[1] , which indicates the probability of lower death rates and higher retention of the existing templateTitle[1] . With a land mass of less than half that of the United States and a templateTitle[1] almost four times greater , templateTitle[3] has recognized potential problems of its growing templateTitle[1] . Government attempts to implement family planning programs have achieved varying degrees of success . Initiatives such as sterilization programs in the 1970s have been blamed for creating general antipathy to family planning , but the combined efforts of various family planning and contraception programs have helped halve fertility rates since the 1960s . The templateTitle[1] growth rate has correspondingly shrunk as well , but has not yet reached less than one percent growth per templateXLabel[0] . As home to thousands of ethnic groups , hundreds of languages , and numerous religions , a cohesive and broadly-supported effort to reduce templateTitle[1] growth is difficult to create . Despite that , templateTitle[3] is one country to watch in coming years . It is also a growing economic power ; among other measures , its GDP per capita was expected to triple between 2003 and 2013 and was listed as the third-ranked country for its share of the global gross domestic product .

A full treatment including templateTitle[6] extensions is significantly more expensive than a soft templateTitle[3] polish . templateTitle[3] versus acrylic The main alternative to gel-based templateTitle[6] treatments is acrylic treatments . templateTitle[3] treatments are a relatively new invention compared to acrylic templateTitle[6] treatments , emerging in the 1980 's . Many people prefer templateTitle[3] templateTitle[6] treatments , claiming they have a more natural feeling while providing a longer-lasting , glossier finish with no chipping , peeling or cracking . However , templateTitle[3] templateTitle[6] are more complicated to apply than acrylic treatments , making acrylic templateTitle[4] and full sets cheaper than their templateTitle[3] alternatives . In 2019 , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] was estimated to be around 8,957.89 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] . templateTitle[9] and the economic crisis Due to slight economic growth , templateTitle[9] is beginning to be recognized as an emerging market and one of the newer industrialized countries in the world . After the global financial recession , many economical aspects of the country crashed . However , templateTitle[9] implemented stimulus packages , including temporary tax cuts , and as a result , templateTitle[9] 's economy recovered from the crisis faster than many other nations . Not only is templateTitle[9] 's economic recovery is evident in an annual rise in templateYLabel[0] , but also in a significant plunge in unemployment since the crash as well as in a decrease of the inflation rate ( 277044 ) , which reached decade-low levels . templateTitle[9] specializes in the production of clothing , automotive , iron and steel , chemicals and agricultural products . Due to a high agricultural output rate , templateTitle[9] has been efficient in food production and is viewed as one of the most plentiful producers of fresh fruit worldwide . Agricultural production has also seen growth over the years in the country ; however templateTitle[9] has slowly become less dependent on it as a main source of income .

Both are seasonally adjusted . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[0] is defined as a situation when an employed person is laid off , fired or quits his work and is still looking for a job . Even in a healthy economy templateYLabel[0] occurs . If former employed persons go back to school or leave the job to take care of children they are no longer part of the active labor force and therefore not among the unemployed . templateYLabel[0] can also be the effect of events that are not part of the normal dynamics of an economy . Layoffs can be the result of technological progress , for example when robots replace workers in automobile production . Sometimes templateYLabel[0] is caused by job outsourcing , due to the fact that employers often search for cheap labor around the globe and not only domestically . A rise in templateYLabel[0] was also an effect of the financial crisis that hit the United States in 2008 . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in the United States varies from state to state . The state with the highest number of unemployed persons in the United States in 2018 was California . Around 815,000 unemployed persons were counted in California .

Medicaid is a templateTitle[0] care program for families in the United States living on a low income . It is funded by both state and federal governments and managed by individual states . The program was created in 1965 under the Social Security Amendments . Total Medicaid spending in the United States is highest in California and New York , reaching some 84 billion templateTitle[6] dollars and 75 billion templateTitle[6] dollars , respectively , in fiscal templateXLabel[0] templateTitle[9] . There were about 11.7 million Medicaid ( and CHIP ) enrollees in California and 6.5 million enrollees in New York as of 2019 . Standard of living in templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] is one of the so-called BRIC countries , an acronym which stands for Brazil , Russia , templateTitle[3] and China , the four states considered the major emerging market countries . They are all in a similar advanced economic state and are expected to advance even further . templateTitle[3] is also among the twenty leading countries with the largest gross domestic product / GDP , and the twenty countries with the largest proportion of global gross domestic product / GDP based on Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) . Its unemployment rate has been stable over the past few templateYLabel[5] ; templateTitle[3] is also among the leading import and export countries worldwide . This alone should put templateTitle[3] in a relatively comfortable position economically speaking , however , parts of the population of templateTitle[3] are struggling with poverty and health problems . When looking at a comparison of the median age of the population in selected countries – i.e . one half of the population is older and the other half is younger – , it can be seen that the median age of the Indian population is about twenty templateYLabel[5] less than that of the Germans or Japanese . In fact , the median age in templateTitle[3] is significantly lower than the median age of the population of the other emerging BRIC countries – Russia , China and Brazil . Additionally , the total population of templateTitle[3] has been steadily increasing . Same-sex marriage in the templateTitle[6] After years of advocacy , same-sex marriage became legal in the United States in June 2015 . The templateTitle[6] Supreme Court ruled that same-sex marriage was legal in a landmark ruling in the case of Obergefell v. Hodges . Degree of templateTitle[0] in templateTitle[2] – additional information templateTitle[0] is generally defined as a process of people migrating from rural to templateYLabel[2] areas , during which towns and cities templateYLabel[0] formed and increase in size . Even though templateTitle[0] is not exclusively a modern phenomenon , industrialization and modernization did accelerate its progress . As shown in the statistic at hand , the degree of templateTitle[0] of templateTitle[2] , the world 's second-largest economy , rose from 39 percent in 2002 to around 51 percent in 2011 . That templateXLabel[0] , the templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] surpassed the number of rural residents for the first time in the country 's history . According to the templateTitle[0] blueprint , issued in March 2013 by the Communist Party and State Council , templateTitle[2] aims at reaching 70 percent templateTitle[0] by 2030.The templateTitle[0] rate varies greatly in different parts of templateTitle[2] . While templateTitle[0] is lesser advanced in western or central templateTitle[2] , in most coastal regions in eastern templateTitle[2] more than two-thirds of the templateYLabel[3] lives already in cities . Among the ten largest Chinese cities in templateTitle[5] , seven were located in coastal regions in East and South China.Brazil and Russia , two other BRIC countries , display a much higher degree of templateTitle[0] than templateTitle[2] . On the other hand , in India , the country with the worlds ' second largest templateYLabel[3] , a mere 34.7 percent of the templateYLabel[3] lived in templateYLabel[2] regions as of templateTitle[5] . Similar to other parts of the world , the progress of templateTitle[0] in templateTitle[2] is closely linked to modernization . From templateTitle[3] to templateTitle[5] , the contribution of agriculture to the gross domestic product in templateTitle[2] shrank from 10.73 percent to 7.2 percent . Even more evident was the decrease of workforce in agriculture .

Economy of templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] maintains one of the most stable economies and has been revered as the most secure banking and investment safe haven in the world . The country is viewed as not only one of the most economically advanced countries , but also one of the most politically respected countries , primarily due to having exceptionally good relations with the majority of countries around the world . Despite being affected by recessions in the early and late 2000s , templateTitle[3] sustained a sufficient economy through competent leadership , most notably when considering the amount of money the government spent in comparison to the amount of revenues earned from goods and services . Many countries around the world suffered economically due to overspending , which often indirectly led to higher unemployment rates . However , templateTitle[3] sustained a relatively balanced and low unemployment rate through the years through adequate government spending as well as a high percentage of skilled workers occupying the country 's workforce . A strong economy , beautiful nature and overall distinctive cultures have made templateTitle[3] one of the most visited tourist countries in the world . Additionally , templateTitle[3] is also a relatively popular country to visit for business meetings due to its centralized location and well renowned reputation .

Shaking off the bad rep Electric bicycles continue to enjoy a surge in popularity ; what was once seen as very unfashionable is now becoming a common sight , from rural areas to modern cities . The power-assisted form of the common bicycle has supposedly been able to attract users who previously would not have wished to cycle , i.e . those who may have struggled with hills without the extra power or commuters who preferred an easy drive to work . Once hesitant users go for a ride , their perception of cycling tends to turn positive , and yet , the sudden acceptance of electric bicycles has also been attributed to the fact that professional athletes are heaping praise on electric templateTitle[0] . The issue of purchasing power In recent years purchasing power has become one of most worrying issues of households in templateTitle[0] . In 2015 , a large majority of French perceived their purchasing power as decreasing , while four years later it became one of the main the causes of the Yellow Vests protests in the country . Studies have shown that the purchasing power in the country reached its lowest level between 2010 and 2014 . Household expenditure doubled since 1990 , while 52.4 percent of French middle-income households stated having difficulties to make ends meet in 2017 .

Femicide Femicide , a homicide in which a woman is killed for gender-based reasons , poses a serious problem around the world . In 2018 , roughly one in six Italians believed that femicide was on the rise . Leading causes of death The leading causes of death in the United States include heart disease , cancer , unintentional injuries , chronic lower respiratory diseases and cerebrovascular diseases . However , heart disease and cancer account for around 44 percent of all deaths . Although heart disease and cancer are the leading causes of death for both templateTitle[3] and women , there are slight variations in the leading causes of death among the genders . For example , unintentional injury and suicide account for a larger portion of deaths among templateTitle[3] than they do among women .

China has suffered from a templateYLabel[0] of strong templateYLabel[2] that have resulted in extremely high death tolls . While templateYLabel[2] occur around the globe along the various tectonic plate boundaries , a significant proportion occur around the basin of the Pacific Ocean in what is referred to as the Ring of Fire due to the high degree of tectonic activity . Many of the countries in the Ring of Fire , including Japan , Chile , the United States and New Zealand , led the way in templateYLabel[2] policy and science as a result . The statistic shows the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] of templateTitle[3] from 2014 to 2018 , with projections up until templateTitle[4] . In 2018 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] of templateTitle[3] amounted to around 37.98 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[0] . templateTitle[1] and economy of templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] is the sixth most populated country in the EU , and the ninth most populated one in Europe . After experiencing a minor decline in templateTitle[1] from the mid to late 2000s , templateTitle[3] 's populace has gradually risen annually . Based on current trends , it is estimated that templateTitle[3] will suffer a templateTitle[1] decrease of roughly templateTitle[4] templateYLabel[2] in 2050 , an estimate that is highly plausible due to the ongoing financial crisis in Europe . A reason for the country 's slow but certain growth in templateTitle[1] could be its economic upturn that has seen momentous improvements over the past decade . Due to industrialization during Russian-ruled Congress templateTitle[3] as well as the Great Depression , templateTitle[3] suffered from high amounts of unemployment . However , demand for jobs dramatically increased during the mid 21st century , causing unemployment to plummet . Interestingly , templateTitle[3] is one of the few countries that reported an unemployment rate which was lower than during the years prior to the global financial crisis . A further indication of economic upturn is evident in the country 's gross domestic product , which is primarily an indicator of economic strength and production in a country . templateTitle[3] 's GDP trend coincides with its unemployment rate , having doubled in value and maintained a higher GDP compared to the years prior to the financial crisis of 2008 .

In templateTitle[7] , this figure was 4.16 templateYLabel[4] . templateYLabel[2] and replacement rates A country 's templateYLabel[2] rate is defined as the templateYLabel[0] of live templateYLabel[2] per 1,000 inhabitants , and it is this particularly important templateYLabel[0] that has been decreasing over the past few decades . The declining templateYLabel[2] rate is not solely an American problem , with EU member templateTitle[6] showing comparable rates to the U.S. Additionally , each country has what is called a `` replacement rate . '' The replacement rate is the rate of fertility needed to keep a population stable when compared with the death rate . In the U.S. , the fertility rate needed to keep the population stable is around 2.1 children per woman , but this figure was at 1.77 in 2017 . Falling templateYLabel[2] rates Currently , there is much discussion as to what exactly is causing the templateYLabel[2] rate to decrease in the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] . There seem to be several factors in play , including longer life expectancies , financial concerns ( such as the economic crisis of 2008 ) , and an increased focus on careers , all of which are causing people to wait longer to start a family . How international governments will handle falling populations remains to be seen , but what is clear is that the declining templateYLabel[2] rate is a multifaceted problem without an easy solution .

The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] of a country refers to the share of people who want to work but can not find jobs . This includes workers who have lost jobs and are searching for new ones , workers whose jobs ended due to an economic downturn , and workers for whom there are no jobs because the labor supply in their industry is larger than the number of jobs available . Different statistics suggest which factors contribute to the overall templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] . The Kenyan context The first type , so-called `` search templateYLabel[0] '' , is hardest to see in the data . The closest proxy is templateTitle[3] 's inflation templateYLabel[1] . As workers take new jobs faster , employers are forced to increase wages , leading to higher templateYLabel[0] . Jobs lost due to economic downturns , called `` cyclical templateYLabel[0] '' , can be seen by decreases in the GDP growth templateYLabel[1] , which are not significant in templateTitle[3] . Finally , `` structural templateYLabel[0] '' refers to workers changing the industry , or even economic sector , in which they are working . In templateTitle[3] , more and more workers switch to the services sector . This is often a result of urbanization , but any structural shift in the economy 's composition can lead to this templateYLabel[0] .

The templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] ' economy over the last decade The templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] of America is the world 's largest national economy and the second most prominent trader globally , trailing just behind China . The country is also one of the most populated countries in the world , trailing only China and India . The templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] ' economy prospers primarily due to having a plentiful amount of natural resources and advanced infrastructure to cope with the production of goods and services , as well as the templateTitle[1] and workforce to enable high productivity . Efficient productivity led to a slight growth in GDP almost every templateXLabel[0] over the past decade , despite undergoing several economic hardships towards the late 2000 's . In addition , the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] holds arguably one of the most important financial markets , with the majority of countries around the world having commercial connections with American companies . Dependency on a single market like the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] has however caused several global dilemmas , most evidently seen during the 2008 financial crisis . What initially started off as a bursting of the U.S. housing bubble lead to a worldwide recession and the necessity to reform national economics . Since it was first released by developer Bluehole in March 2017 , PlayerUnknown 's Battlegrounds ( templateTitle[0] ) has developed a loyal legion of fans . While the battle royale game only sold two templateYLabel[3] copies within the first few months of its Early Access release on Steam , this number had jumped to 50 templateYLabel[3] units just a year later in June templateTitle[4] . One of the biggest games on Steam templateTitle[0] is an online multiplayer game which pits up to 100 players against each other at one time . The players must scavenge for weapons and items while killing enemies and trying to survive . The map shrinks over time in order to force the remaining players into combat until only one player or team is left standing . Given the scale of the game , it is unsurprising that it attracts large amounts of players – on the gaming platform Steam , templateTitle[0] peaked at almost 3.24 templateYLabel[3] concurrent players in January templateTitle[4] . The game is also Steam 's biggest draw in terms of hourly average number of players – templateTitle[0] averaged almost 853 thousand players per hour in templateTitle[4] , almost twice the figure of its closest competitor , DOTA templateTitle[4] . So is the game unrivalled in the battle royale genre ? templateTitle[0] 's biggest rival Not if you ask fans of Fortnite . Released by Epic Games in July 2017 , just a few months after the launch of templateTitle[0] , Fortnite is a similar battle royale survival game . While it is not available on Steam , it can be played on PC as well as on all the main consoles . Similarly to templateTitle[0] , Fortnite became an overnight sensation and latest figures have the game at a staggering 250 templateYLabel[3] registered users . The mobile version of the game has also been a commercial success , generating annual revenue of 455 templateYLabel[3] U.S. dollars in the Apple App Store alone in templateTitle[4] . Given that templateTitle[0] won the Best Multiplayer Game at The Game Awards 2017 and Fortnite won the very same award a year later , it seems that the rivalry between these games shows no signs of slowing down .

templateTitle[2] is a widely celebrated tradition in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] , with almost 70 percent of Americans planning to participate in templateTitle[2] celebrations in templateTitle[8] . templateTitle[2] is celebrated in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] in various ways , with handing out candy and pumpkin carving being two of the most popular templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] . templateTitle[2] templateTitle[2] is celebrated around the world on October 31 . It is celebrated in many ways , such as trick-or-treating , carving pumpkins , and dressing up in costumes . This is also a popular time of year for horror and slasher movies , with many movies of this genre released for the templateTitle[2] season . Many believe that the origins of templateTitle[2] date back to the ancient Gaelic festival of Samhain , which marked the end of summer and the harvest season as well as the beginning of winter . It is a time of year which was often associated with death , as some people believed that on the night before the new year , the boundary between the worlds of the living and the dead became blurred . Therefore , they celebrated this night as they believed that the ghosts of the dead returned to earth . templateTitle[2] in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] templateTitle[2] generates a substantial amount of money for the U.S. economy , as Americans spend significant sums over the templateTitle[2] season . The majority of consumers ' money goes towards the purchase of costumes , decorations and candy . Dressing up in a costume has become a popular templateTitle[0] of templateTitle[2] celebrations .

The templateTitle[10] takes into account the results of the immediate past 52 templateYLabel[2] . templateTitle[10] lists are usually issued each Monday except during the duration of the four Grand Slam tournaments and the events in Miami and Indian Wells . This is an increase from templateTitle[8] levels , when there were about 3.4 million templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] with a templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] . templateTitle[3] parenthood The typical family is comprised of two parents and at least one child . However , that is not the case in every templateTitle[3] situation . A templateTitle[3] parent is someone who has a child but no spouse or partner . templateTitle[3] parenthood occurs for different reasons , including divorce , death , abandonment , or single-person adoption . Historically , templateTitle[3] parenthood was common due to mortality rates due to war , diseases , and maternal mortality . However , divorce was not as common back then , depending on the culture . templateTitle[3] parent wellbeing In countries where social welfare programs are not strong , templateTitle[3] parents tend to suffer more financially , emotionally , and mentally . In the United States , most templateTitle[3] parents are templateTitle[4] . The struggles that templateTitle[3] parents face are greater than those in two parent households . Population of templateTitle[3] A member of the Group 7 and G20 , templateTitle[3] is one of the worlds most powerful , advanced and emerging economies . With a total population of around 64 million people , templateTitle[3] 's economy must adapt itself to templateYLabel[0] the growing population . Although the rates of the population growth in the past 5 years have declined in comparison to the population growth rates between 2003 and 2007 , there is still an overall growth in the total population . An important factor which directly affects the French economy is the percentage increase in of people who are 65 years of age or older and percentage decline of people between the ages of 15 and 64 years . Due to the fact that the percentage of the working population is decreasing , mainly people between the ages of 15 and 64 years , and the median age of the population in templateTitle[3] is increasing , the economy must adapt to the growing competition by providing more templateYLabel[0] opportunities . With the Eurozone crisis and global financial crisis of 2008 , the real gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] suffered dramatic drops between 2008 and 2009 in comparison to the previous templateXLabel[0] . Despite having increased between 2009 and 2013 , the templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[3] has not reached the record high of 2008 again yet . The CPI is defined by the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics as `` a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] for a market basket of templateYLabel[0] goods and services '' . In templateTitle[11] templateTitle[12] , the unadjusted CPI amounted to about 257.97 . The annual templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] for templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] in the templateTitle[10] can be accessed here . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] ( CPI ) began in 1919 under the Bureau of Labor Statistics and is published every templateXLabel[0] . The CPI for templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] includes templateTitle[6] households in Metropolitan Statistical Areas and regions with over 2,500 inhabitants , as well as non-farm templateTitle[7] living in rural regions . This templateYLabel[2] was established in 1978 and includes about 80 percent of the templateTitle[10] population . The templateTitle[0] CPI of templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] in the United States increased from 251.71 in templateTitle[11] 2019 to 257.97 in templateTitle[11] templateTitle[12] . For these templateTitle[7] , CPI can also differ between regions , with a high of 270.35 in the Western region as of 2019 . The CPI in the United States has increased steadily over the past two decades from 140.3 in 1992 to 255.66 in 2019 . A forecast of the CPI expects this positive trend to continue , reaching 287.51 by 2024 . As of templateTitle[11] templateTitle[12] , the CPI of the nation 's education had increased by 2.2 percent . In templateTitle[11] templateTitle[12] , costs of recreation , rent , housing , medical care , gasoline , and food and beverages had increased , but prices for apparel , personal computers had decreased . Comparatively , the CPI in Hong Kong reached 107 in 2018 .

The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] from 1999 to templateTitle[4] . In templateTitle[4] , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] was estimated to be 2.55 percent . templateTitle[3] 's economy in comparison to other BRIC states templateTitle[3] possesses one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and as a result , templateTitle[3] is recognized as one of the G-20 major economies as well as a member of the BRIC countries , an association that is made up of rapidly growing economies . As well as templateTitle[3] , three other countries , namely Brazil , Russia and China , are BRIC members . templateTitle[3] 's manufacturing industry plays a large part in the development of its economy ; however its services industry is the most significant economical factor . The majority of the population of templateTitle[3] works in this sector . templateTitle[3] 's notable economic boost can be attributed to significant gains over the past decade in regards to the efficiency of the production of goods as well as maintaining relatively low debt , particularly when compared to the total amount earned from goods and services produced throughout the years . When considering individual development as a country , templateTitle[3] progressed significantly over the years . However , in comparison to the other emerging countries in the BRIC group , templateTitle[3] 's progress was rather minimal . While China experienced the most apparent growth , templateTitle[3] 's efficiency and productivity remained somewhat stagnant over the course of 3 or 4 years . templateTitle[3] also reported a rather large trade deficit over the past decade , implying that its total imports exceeded its total amount of exports , essentially forcing the country to borrow money in order to finance the nation . Most economists consider trade deficits a negative factor , especially in the long run and for developing or emerging countries .

A recent survey revealed that , on average , almost 80 percent of the adult population felt unsafe . The perceived level of insecurity in templateTitle[0] is more worrisome among women than men . In recent years , violence against women in templateTitle[0] has significantly worsened . Violence against women in templateTitle[0] The number of femicides registered in templateTitle[0] has more than doubled between 2015 and templateTitle[6] . Up to 976 women were murdered in templateTitle[0] in templateTitle[6] solely on account of their gender . Over the past decade , most Mexican states have adopted this criminal typification to address the increasing cases of homicide motivated by gender . Veracruz was the region with the largest number of femicides reported as such in templateTitle[6] , whereas Morelos stood out as the Mexican state with the highest prevalence of femicides , based on 100,000 women .

Generally , countries with larger populations consume more energy . However , Canada was one of the highest consumers of templateTitle[1] at 538 terawatt templateYLabel[5] , despite having a population of about 36 million inhabitants . Per capita templateYLabel[1] of templateTitle[1] can vary widely due to templateTitle[1] rates , appliances penetration , market saturation , and heating and cooling . templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[1] tends to be smaller than the amount of templateTitle[1] generated due to several factors , such as grid and storage losses and self-consumption from power plants . However , cogeneration power plants are able to use energy that is often wasted in forms of heat or energy for industrial processes . In Alberta , Canada , templateTitle[1] cogeneration energy production accounted for 25 terawatt templateYLabel[5] . Marriage requirements in templateTitle[5] Marriage in templateTitle[5] is administered by the Parliament of templateTitle[5] . Both religious and nonreligious ceremonies are allowed , but all marriages must be recognized by the government . Same-sex marriage has been legal in templateTitle[5] since 2005 . The minimum age of the spouses for marriage is 16 , but each province is able to set their own minimum age , which could result in the minimum age being higher than 16 years old . As a result , most provinces have increased the minimum age threshold to be templateTitle[8] or 19 years old , and there are very few templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[2] between the ages of 15 and 19 years old . Who gets templateTitle[2] ? Ontario was the province with the most templateTitle[2] couples living there . The economy of templateTitle[7] templateTitle[7] is the second biggest country in the world after Russia and the biggest country in North America . Despite its large size , templateTitle[7] has a relatively small population of just around 35.9 million people . However , the total population in templateTitle[7] is estimated to grow to around 37.5 million inhabitants in 2020 . The standard of living in the country is pretty high , the life expectancy as of 2013 in templateTitle[7] ranks as one of the highest in the world . In addition , the country ranks number eight on the Human Development Index ( HDI ) worldwide . All key factors point to a stable and sustainable economy . Not only is templateTitle[7] 's population increasing , but the economy has been slowly recovering after the global financial crisis in 2008 . The unemployment rate in templateTitle[7] in 2010 was at approximately 8 percent ( 263696 ) . Today , the unemployment rate in templateTitle[7] is estimated to be around 6.8 percent , and it is estimated to decrease further . During the financial crisis in 2008 , templateTitle[7] 's inflation rate amounted to around 2.4 percent . By 2013 , the inflation rate was at less than 1 percent in comparison to the previous templateXLabel[0] . templateTitle[7] is considered to be one of the world 's wealthiest countries . By value of private financial wealth , templateTitle[7] ranked seventh along with Italy . In addition , its templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] per capita in 2014 was among the largest in the world and during the same templateXLabel[0] , its templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] increased by over 2.5 percent in comparison to the previous templateXLabel[0] . templateTitle[7] 's economic growth has been a result of its political stability and economic reforms following the global financial crisis . In the period between 2009 and 2010 , templateTitle[7] was among the leading countries with the highest political stability in the world .

Firearms in the United States Firearms in the United States have become a large part of American culture . The Second Amendment of the Constitution protects the right to keep and bear arms . This amendment has been cited as a reason why gun control laws should not become stricter . However , many Americans are in favor of stricter gun control laws due to the increase of shootings in the country . Handguns were the most frequently used weapon used on murder victims in templateTitle[8] , and overall , the United States was the country with the highest rate of civilian-owned firearms . Who owns firearms ? Firearms are more popular in certain parts of the United States than others . Texas was the state with the highest number of registered weapons in 2019 , with Florida , California , Virginia , and Pennsylvania rounding out the top five . templateTitle[2] laws vary from state to state , which means it is easier to obtain a templateTitle[2] in some states than in others . Gun owners in the United States are typically white , and men are more likely to personally own a gun than women .

templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] has been falling in templateTitle[4] in the past decade , from 43.2 templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] 1,000 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] in 2008 to 25.1 in templateTitle[5] . This figure helps to assess the overall healthcare system 's efficacy , because childbirth and templateTitle[0] care require more direct patient care than any other period of life . Similarly , measures taken to combat templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] often have spillover effects , improving the entire healthcare system . Population in templateTitle[4] templateTitle[4] has one of the highest population densities in the world . While the economy is growing at a fair templateTitle[2] , gross domestic product ( GDP ) templateYLabel[1] capita is still low . This points to templateTitle[4] 's status as a developing nation . However , these indicators also suggest that the country continues to flourish . This development can benefit a significant number of people . Other development indicators As health outcomes improve , life expectancy should follow . This will lead to an upward shift in the population pyramid , which measures the age structure in a country . Such a change means that there are more workers in the medium term , increasing the country 's productivity . Productivity growth then enables more expenditure on health care , creating a virtuous cycle . For this reason , experts follow templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] closely .

In economics , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is a measurement of templateYLabel[0] , the templateYLabel[1] of increase of a price index ( in this case : consumer price index ) . It is the percentage templateYLabel[1] of change in prices level over time . The templateYLabel[1] of decrease in the purchasing power of money is approximately equal . According to the forecast , prices will increase by two percent in 2019 . The templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] for previous years can be found here and the consumer price index for all urban consumers here . The monthly templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] for the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] can also be accessed here . templateYLabel[0] in the U.S. templateYLabel[0] is a term used to describe a general rise in the price of goods and services in an economy over a given period of time . templateYLabel[0] in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] is calculated using the consumer price index ( CPI ) . The consumer price index is a measure of change in the price level of a preselected market basket of consumer goods and services purchased by households . This forecast of U.S. templateYLabel[0] was prepared by the International Monetary Fund . They templateTitle[0] roughly a 2.25 percent templateTitle[1] rise in the general level of prices until templateTitle[10] . This means that a product bought today for about 100 U.S. dollars will cost about 102.25 U.S. dollars next templateXLabel[0] , and so on . Considering the templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] in recent years , a 2.25 percent templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is a very moderate projection . Although the moderate templateYLabel[0] of prices between templateTitle[8] and 3 percent is considered normal in a modern economy , countries ' central banks try to prevent severe templateYLabel[0] and deflation to keep the growth of prices to a minimum . Severe templateYLabel[0] is considered dangerous to a country 's economy because it can rapidly diminish the population 's purchasing power and thus damage the GDP .

In this century , the life expectancy in templateTitle[6] has increased by roughly 2.5 templateYLabel[3] since 2007 , reaching 75.5 in 2017 . The standard of living is increasing In templateTitle[6] , people ages templateTitle[7] to 64 have consistently made up the majority of the templateTitle[4] from 2007 to 2017 . Spanish economy The Spanish economy , though in a state of turmoil , has been one of the world 's largest and most important economies . As a member of the European Union and the World Trade Organization , templateTitle[3] often plays an important role in modern day economics . templateTitle[3] maintains several economic strengths , some of which include a modern high-tech infrastructure as well as an abundance of exports , which rank as some of the highest in the world . Additionally , templateTitle[3] 's economical sectors , principally built upon tourism and automobiles , also rank amongst some of the most significant around the globe . Tourism plays an important role in templateTitle[3] 's economy , with millions of tourists visiting the plentiful amount of beaches during the summer and historical sites all templateXLabel[0] round . In the past , templateTitle[3] was considered the most frequently visited country in the world , however , it fell several places in the past couple years , primarily because of the country 's ongoing economical struggles . Tourism is arguably the most significant sector in templateTitle[3] , making up a large percentage of the country 's entire GDP . The Spanish automobile industry has receded for several years , but still makes notable contributions to the economy and has some of the more powerful car manufacturers in the world .

Political reforms in the 1980s created greater economic stability in templateTitle[2] in the decade that followed and led to higher templateTitle[0] . The growing templateXLabel[3] of templateTitle[2] , as well as people migrating from rural areas , contributes to an escalating number of inhabitants in the country 's already crowded cities . Agricultural sector becoming less prominent In 2008 , nearly half the templateXLabel[3] of templateTitle[2] worked in agriculture . Ten years later , as more people leave rural areas , the service sector is comparable in size , employing roughly a third of the templateXLabel[3] , while employment in the industry sector has grown to a quarter . Though agriculture has long had the most workers , the service and industry sectors accounted for larger shares of templateTitle[2] 's GDP from 2007 to 2017 . Costs in rural and templateTitle[0] areas In rural areas of templateTitle[2] , investment in agriculture – such as the costs of farming – was the second-highest expense in 2019 . In templateTitle[0] areas , around the same templateXLabel[0] was spent on aspirational living costs such as eating out and holidays , while investment was the category with the least amount of monthly spending . The expense associated with farming in rural areas is a possible cause for the increased migration to cities , with fewer people employed in the agricultural sector and more working in services such as health care , education , hospitality , and gastronomy .

Welfare in the templateYLabel[4] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] first started in 1935 during the Great Depression as a part of President Franklin D. Roosevelt 's New Deal . The Social Security Act of 1935 ensured that Americans would not fall deeper into poverty . The United States was the only developed nation in the world at the time that did not offer any welfare templateTitle[2] . This program created templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] , Medicare and Medicaid , and maternal and child welfare . The only major welfare program that the United States currently lacks is a templateTitle[3] maternity leave policy . Currently , the United States only offers 12 unpaid weeks of leave , under certain circumstances . However , the number of people without health insurance in the United States has greatly decreased since 2010 . templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] Current templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] in the United States vary from state to state , because templateTitle[1] is funded by both the state and the federal government . The average duration of people collecting templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] in the United States has fluctuated since January templateTitle[7] , from as little as 10.87 weeks to as many as 19.3 weeks . The templateTitle[1] rate varies by ethnicity , gender , and education levels . For example , those aged 16 to 24 have faced the highest templateTitle[1] rates since 1990 . As of December templateTitle[7] , the Buffalo-Cheektowaga-Niagara Falls , New York metropolitan area had the highest templateTitle[1] rate in the United States .

In 2014 , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] amounted to about 61.44 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] . templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateTitle[4] additional information Commonly referred to as the `` tree of life '' , the templateTitle[1] has a wide range of uses . The coir , a natural elastic fiber taken from templateTitle[1] husks , can be used to make floor mats , brushes , ropes and strings . templateTitle[1] leaves can be used to make brooms , baskets , roofing thatches and temporary sheds . templateTitle[1] lumber is used for building houses and furniture . Fuel and charcoal can be produced from husks and templateTitle[1] shells . templateTitle[1] oil , templateTitle[1] milk and copra are among products extracted from templateTitle[1] meat . templateTitle[1] water has gained popularity over the last few years—not only as refreshment but also as a sports drink . In addition to that , coconuts have been used to create musical instruments in China , Vietnam , the Middle East and Eastern Europe . In the Philippines , alcoholic beverages are created from coconuts . While the templateTitle[1] is a staple in many households in tropical regions , it is still considered exotic by most Western countries . Agriculturists classify the templateTitle[1] as a drupe which is a fruit , a templateTitle[1] and a seed in one . Many Asian cultures consider the templateTitle[1] as a potent cure for illnesses such as nausea , rash , fever and the like . Moreover , nutritionists claim that coconuts contain naturally sterile electrolytes , high amounts of fiber , lauric acid , manganese , potassium and phosphorus . Since 2007 , about 60 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] of coconuts had been produced worldwide annually . The New York Yankees are one of the most recognisable and valuable sports brands on the planet , no doubt in part due to their success on the baseball field . The New York franchise has templateYLabel[4] the templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateTitle[4] a record 27 times , with their closest rivals in terms of titles , the St. Louis Cardinals , having lifted the trophy 11 times . However , the Yankees fans have been starved of success in recent years as the templateXLabel[0] 's last templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] title came back in 2009 . templateTitle[0] templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] Baseball in North America has a long history , dating back at least to the 1850s , when it was already referred to as the national game or national pastime . In the late 1800s , the National Association of Base Ball Players , the sport 's first governing body , was formed in the New York area . Today , Major League Baseball ( templateTitle[0] ) is the governing body of professional baseball in the United States and Canada , uniting two leagues — the American League ( AL ) and the National League ( AL ) , each with 15 teams and three divisions . Every October , the winners of each league templateTitle[4] templateYLabel[3] meet in order to play the templateTitle[0] templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] , the most important event of the baseball season . New York Yankees The Yankees , who play in the American League East , were established in 1901 under the name The Orioles in Baltimore and were rebranded in 1913 in New York . The New York Yankees are the most valuable franchise in Major League Baseball . As of templateTitle[10] , the templateXLabel[0] 's brand value is estimated at some 4.6 billion U.S. dollars , far ahead of the Los Angeles Dodgers in second place with a value of 3.3 billion U.S. dollars . The Yankees play their homes games at Yankee Stadium in the Bronx area of New York City . The stadium has a capacity of just over 47 thousand for baseball games and the average attendance for a Yankees game during the 2018 season stood at just under 43 thousand . As a result , a total of almost 3.5 million spectators passed through the gates of Yankee Stadium across the season , a decrease from the 4.27 million fans who enjoyed the games live during the 2007 season .

Between 1991 and 2016 , there were 3,796 illnesses due to templateTitle[2] linked to live poultry in the country as well as 6 deaths . Salmonellosis , an infection caused templateTitle[6] templateTitle[2] , usually lasts between 4 to 7 days and generally patients recover without any treatment . templateTitle[2] can be transferred from animal products to humans so the best preventative measures are to cook food such as poultry , ground beef , and eggs thoroughly . Cross-contamination of these food items should also be avoided . In very young and elderly patients , the bacteria may enter the bloodstream and require antibiotherapy to cure the patient . templateTitle[2] can also lead to other illnesses such as typhoid fever , paratyphoid fever , and food poisoning . About 67.9 million templateTitle[4] dollars were donated for research and development on the templateTitle[2] infection globally in 2015 .

In 2018 , templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] was at around 42,953.27 US dollars.Suffering competitiveness templateYLabel[0] is one of the primary indicators that is used to gauge the state of health of a country 's economy . It is the total market value of all completed goods and services that have been produced within a country in a given period of time , usually a templateXLabel[0] . templateYLabel[0] figures allow us to understand a country 's economy in a clear way . Real templateYLabel[0] , in a similar way , is also a very useful indicator ; this is a measurement that takes prices changes ( inflation and deflation ) into account , therefore acting as a key indicator for economic growth . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] is predicted to continue falling in 2013 after a short period of growth in 2011 indicated that it may not , in fact , be on the mend . The country has been suffering significant economic hardship since the economic crisis of 2008 swept across the world . The European Union 's second largest economy is experiencing a shocking deterioration in its level of competitiveness . The items – cars , clothing , steel , electrical goods – that templateTitle[9] is producing are simply failing to compete with the goods produced by Asian countries and its European neighbours , which , in turn , is leading to an accelerating fall in exports and a notable decline in the service and manufacturing sectors that support them . It could be argued that up until now templateTitle[9] has managed to maintain its status as a reliable northern eurozone country , propped up by the uncontested reliability and strength of its principal partner , Germany .

In templateYLabel[2] , it had lowered to 16.2 percent . The templateTitle[6] with the widest gap between the rich and the poor was New York , with a gini coefficient score of 0.52 in 2017 . The Gini coefficient is calculated by looking at average templateYLabel[1] rates . A score of zero would reflect perfect templateYLabel[1] equality and a score of one indicates a society where one person would have all the money and all other people have nothing .

The substantial improvement of templateTitle[9] 's templateYLabel[0] and the country 's economic situation in general is a result of billions of templateYLabel[5] worth of international investments as well as enhancements in agricultural production . However , many aspects of templateTitle[9] 's economy are still flawed , most distinctly within its employment sector , but also regarding revenues and expenses . templateTitle[9] held one of the highest unemployment rates in the world in 2009 , with roughly 35 percent of its entire population being registered as unemployed . Additionally , templateTitle[9] has maintained a trade deficit over the past decade , implying that its imports exceeded its exports . The country 's highest trade deficits occurred after the financial crisis took place , however has since impeded . Another reason for templateTitle[9] 's economic crisis was the templateTitle[9] War . Prior to the war , the country had struggled economically in many forms and became further encumbered after the destruction of infrastructure , production facilities and farmland , as well as trade routes . However with President Obama 's plan to pull American soldiers from templateTitle[9] soil and to end the war , it is expected that the economic situation in templateTitle[9] will improve .

Economy and templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[3] Since reaching a decade low in 2007 , templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[3] has experienced considerable surges , most notably after 2011 . This is mainly the cause of their late 2000s recession , originally triggered by the global crisis . Additionally , templateTitle[3] experienced its highest spike in national debt from 2007 to 2011 ) , indicating that it is becoming more dependent on other nations to fund and fuel its economy . A significant reason for the country 's national debt is inefficient budgeting as well as incompetent leadership . Over the same timeframe as the crisis , templateTitle[3] reported extensive trade deficits year-over-year , implying that they imported more than they exported . templateTitle[3] experienced its largest trade deficit in 2010 , mainly from their trade balance of goods , which reached a decade low . In 2013 , templateTitle[3] earned a place as one of the top templateTitle[4] leading import countries worldwide , ahead of prominent exporters such as Canada and Saudi Arabia . This signifies that the country is in fact capable of producing and selling goods however require funding from other countries to complete the job , which subsequently leads to a higher national debt .
