It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country . In 2018 , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] was around 34,320.75 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] . templateTitle[9] 's struggling economy templateTitle[9] 's templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] has been unstable since 2008 , often experiencing slight increases and decreases annually . The third largest economy of the euro area not only suffered from the global financial crisis , they were also one of the primary victims of the euro area crisis . One of the outcomes is the significant growth of templateTitle[9] 's national debt , which saw continued upsurges every templateXLabel[0] over the past decade . With the collapse of investments and loss of industrial production , the Italian state was forced to resort to increase taxation and decrease spending . Additionally , templateTitle[9] was forced to borrow more , which in turn increased national debt and furthermore their debt-to-GDP ratio . A debt-to-GDP ratio is significant to help determine if a country can pay off its debts without incurring more . Increased taxation and decrease spending helped with reducing expenditures as well as raising revenues , however templateTitle[9] still maintained a trade balance deficit , which has only recently < started to recover . Several reasons for templateTitle[9] 's downturn as a country are unnecessary spending and incompetent leadership .
The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] from 1999 to templateTitle[4] . In templateTitle[4] , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] was at about 11.9 percent . Trade in templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] is a growing market and recognized as one of the world 's newest industrialized countries . Partially due templateTitle[3] 's fast growing economy , the country was able to save up and maintain a relatively large currency reserve . Currency reserves are most important in dire financial situations . templateTitle[3] is also a member of the G-20 major economies and the EU Customs Union , an organization made up of EU countries as well as neighboring countries that essentially allow no customs to be levied on goods being traded within the borders of these countries . As a result , a large percentage of goods imported and exported were going to and coming from countries within the custom borders . However , many Turkish officials believed that it was necessary to expand exports beyond westernized countries in order to further develop the country 's trade sector , and for this reason , trades with countries such as Iran and Iraq . Primary imports into templateTitle[3] consist of machinery , chemicals , semi-finished goods , fuels and transport equipment . Additionally , a large part of those imports are made up of cotton , with templateTitle[3] being one of the largest importers of cotton in the world . Due to large imports and struggles with its exports , templateTitle[3] reported a trade deficit every templateXLabel[0] over the past decade with increasing difficulties to attain a trade surplus .
The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] from 1999 to templateTitle[4] . In templateTitle[4] , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] amounted to about 3.27 percent . Economy of templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] holds the sixth largest economy and is the ninth most populated country in the EU , with the country 's population remaining relatively stagnant over the past decade . templateTitle[3] 's economy has maintained rather strong and stable , and its GDP was reported to have grown over the past several years , despite being affected by the global recession of 2009 . Various factors that attributed to the fast recovery and maintenance of templateTitle[3] 's economy were a large market as well as multiple economic transformations that were essentially introduced to help with the country 's transition from the fall of communism . Additionally , templateTitle[3] sustained a low level of debt , particularly in comparison with the country 's gross domestic product , which indicates that templateTitle[3] is capable of paying back its debts without incurring further debt . templateTitle[3] primarily trades with its European neighbors , most prominently Germany . Imports within the country consist mainly of goods that are used for manufacturing and as a result , templateTitle[3] reported a trade balance deficit . However , since these goods are used for the further development of the country rather than for consumption , a trade balance deficit is seen as acceptable and rather positive than negative . Today , templateTitle[3] 's industry is principally focused on machinery , electronics and car manufacturing and has several large mining reserves available for export and further reconstruction within the country .

In the first two months of templateTitle[6] , 2.3 thousand migrants arrived by sea in templateTitle[3] . In 2019 , 11.5 thousand migrants templateTitle[1] on the Italian coasts . Between templateTitle[4] and 2019 , the templateYLabel[0] of migrants setting foot in the country peaked in 2016 at 181 thousand templateYLabel[2] . Among the most frequent nationalities declared upon templateTitle[1] , Tunisian and Pakistani ranked first and second . More specifically , 2.6 thousand people declared coming from Tunisia , while 1.2 thousand were Pakistani . Asylum seekers and minors among the migrants In September 2019 , the largest templateYLabel[0] of asylum applicants in templateTitle[3] were from Pakistan . For instance , 779 requests were recorded only in that month . In addition , 218 applicants were from Nigeria , the second most common nationality among the asylum seekers . In the last years , many unaccompanied minors reached the Italian coasts . Between January and October 2019 , over a thousand children migrated without their parents into the country . Contrasting opinions and distorted perceptions According to the data published by Ipsos , a part of Italians tend to overestimate the size of the immigrated population . The results of this survey uncovered the presence of distorted perceptions in 2018 : people thought that about 28 percent of the Italian population was not born in templateTitle[3] , whereas the actual percentage was around ten . Furthermore , the public opinion on migration was controversial . In the same templateXLabel[0] , roughly half of the population perceived migrants as a risk for the Italian economy . On the other hand , 18 percent of Italians believed that migration could be a resource for the country .

In templateTitle[9] , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] in the United States amounted to about 47.9 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[0] foods are foods that are manufactured using templateTitle[0] farming standards . Those agricultural standards are regulated by the department of government responsible for them and contain regulations for the cultivation of templateTitle[1] and animal welfare . In particular , the use of chemical fertilizers , synthetic pesticides , growth hormones and antibiotics is not allowed or only partly permitted . In addition , fewer templateTitle[1] additives are permitted for the processing of templateTitle[0] foods . In the United States , templateTitle[0] foods are certified by the National templateTitle[0] Program . Products which have fulfilled the criteria are labeled with the term ‘ templateTitle[0] ' on the templateTitle[1] packaging . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] have experienced tremendous growth in the last decade . For this reason , not only specialized retailers sell templateTitle[0] foods but also traditional supermarkets and discounters . Widely known specialized templateTitle[0] retailers in the United States include Whole Foods Market and Sprouts Farmers Market . Whole Foods Market is the largest specialized templateTitle[0] retailer in the United States with headquarters in Austin , Texas . It was founded in 1980 and operates more than 450 stores in the United States . In general , templateTitle[0] foods are usually offered at a higher price level than their conventional counterparts . A recent survey revealed that consumers actively try to include templateTitle[0] products in their diet . Whether or not templateTitle[0] foods are healthier and more nutritious compared to conventionally farmed produce is a much debated subject . Up to now , no evidence of significant differences between the two farming methods where taste or health are concerned has been established .

Life in templateTitle[6] The Republic of templateTitle[6] is a sovereign state archipelago in Southeast Asia . templateTitle[6] is made up of more than 17,000 islands , with the biggest three being Java , Sumatra and Borneo . Currently , there are more than 7 billion people in the world and Asia is the continent with the largest templateTitle[4] . More than 4 billion people lived in Asia in mid-2014 . templateTitle[6] is the second most populous country in Asia , behind China ( 262879 ) and the fourth most populous nation in the world . In 2018 , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] was around 30,733.17 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] . templateTitle[9] 's struggling economy The Spanish economy is essential for the global market , as it remains one of the largest economies in the world as well as within Europe . The aftermath of the global financial crisis and the Eurozone crisis resulted in an economic collapse , which has yet to be completely resolved by the Spanish government . While unemployment has always been a general weakness for templateTitle[9] , the occurrence of recent economic disasters has fueled the struggles in the country 's job market , resulting in a decade high unemployment rate . During the prime of both crises , not only millions of workers were laid off , but government spending also reached a new high , considerably exceeding national revenues earned . This not only resulted in further layoffs in the following years , but also burdened the country with almost double the amount of debt . Prior to the crisis , the public already assumed that the Spanish economy would decline , however the public opinion of the situation became conclusive post 2009 . The lack of consumer confidence is only further damaging the Spanish economy , as investors have already pulled much capital from the troubled nation and are hesitant to reinvest their money .

Baby food The templateTitle[0] baby food templateTitle[3] comprises foods intended for the special templateTitle[2] of babies and infants . The largest single categories on the baby food templateTitle[3] are baby formula , dried baby food , and prepared baby food . Baby foods are usually divided into different stages so that they are suitable for each phase of the child 's individual development . The American Academy of Pediatrics ( AAP ) recommends breast milk as the ideal food to meet a baby 's needs in the first stages right after birth . If breastfeeding is not an option , parents have the possibility of using baby formulas . Those are available as powdered and ready-to-drink baby formula . After a couple of months more and more solid foods as type of purees or strained foods are introduced into the baby 's meal plan until the child is ready , usually by the age of one templateXLabel[0] , for the introduction of family table food . Consumers can decide if they want to make the purees and strained foods at home or if they buy them already prepared at a retail store . The baby food templateTitle[3] in the United States is regulated by the Food and Drug Administration . Leading baby food brands include Gerber , Beech-Nut and Plum Organics . Gerber is now a subsidiary of the largest templateTitle[0] food company Nestlé S.A. which has headquarters in Vevey , Switzerland . Recent trends show that baby food manufacturers have expanded their product portfolio by launching additional toddler foods which are intended for toddlers from about twelve months to two or three years .

Economy of templateTitle[9] templateTitle[9] is the third largest economy in North America and is swiftly becoming a modernized nation with more industrial and service sectors to maintain and promote economic growth nationwide . templateTitle[9] is primarily an export-oriented economy and has seen constant growth in regards to the export of goods every templateXLabel[0] over the past decade , with the exception of 2009 . templateTitle[9] is also considered to be one of the premier exporters in the world , exporting more goods and services than other export-prominent countries such as Saudi Arabia and India . Like many other industrial countries worldwide , templateTitle[9] experienced an economic downturn during the global financial crisis . Several indicators of templateTitle[9] 's economic slump would be a spike in unemployment as well as a significant drop in templateYLabel[0] in 2009 . Additionally , inflation rates slightly increased over the course of templateTitle[10] years . However , templateTitle[9] 's economy evidently recovered , in particular with its inflation rate , which reached a decade low , as well as its templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] , which attained decade high values , both in 2014 .

Pharmacies and templateTitle[2] Stores IndustryThe retail templateTitle[2] industry is comprised of pharmacies or drugstores , as they are known in North America . With an aging population and greater prevalence of chronic diseases , the need for safe , legal pharmaceutical drugs is constantly rising.Pharmacies and templateTitle[2] stores dispense prescription medications and over-the-counter drugs directly to patients . However , their role is more than one of simple distribution as they dispense medication in specific doses , adhere to optimal conditions of storage and give valuable advice to patients . Pharmacies practice in a wide range of locations such as communities , hospitals , clinics and nursing homes . Other templateTitle[2] retail outlets include supermarkets , and independent and online pharmacies , which offer mail-order drugs to patients , proving especially convenient for those that may be unable to leave their homes . Apart from selling drugs , miscellaneous products also account for a percentage of templateTitle[4] for these retail outlets , such as cosmetics and confectioneries.The retail templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] industry employs many different types of workers . Each templateTitle[3] has a manager , along with department managers or assistant managers to handle additional administrative duties . templateTitle[4] associates are generally entry-level retail workers . Pharmacists require a specialized degree and licensing to dispense medication .

The statistic presents the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] of US-registered templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] from templateTitle[8] to templateTitle[10] . It was found that the templateYLabel[0] global templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] of templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] registered in the United States amounted to approximately 17.71 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] in templateTitle[10] . templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[4] additional information templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] are investment templateTitle[6] in which the capital is pooled from a number of different investors and then used to buy securities such as stocks , bonds or money market instruments . Although investing in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] , rather than direct investment in individual securities , still presents a certain degree of risk , it has become more and more common practice around the templateTitle[7] . One of the biggest advantages of this type of investment is the fact that the templateTitle[6] templateYLabel[2] are managed by professionals , who aim to eliminate some of the risk involved in investing in individual stocks and bonds through diversification of templateYLabel[2] . There are eight airports serving the templateTitle[3] area , including Gatwick ( IATA : LGW ) , Stansted ( IATA : STN ) and templateTitle[4] ( IATA : LHR ) . templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] is the largest templateTitle[5] in the United Kingdom and the third busiest in the world , handling well over 65 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[2] annually . To put this figure into perspective , the templateTitle[5] handled more templateYLabel[2] in 2011 than the airports in Orlando and Philadelphia combined . In 2011 , around 77.4 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[2] boarded or left the planes at Beijing Capital International templateTitle[5] ( IATA : PEK ) in China , while the world 's busiest templateTitle[5] in Atlanta ( IATA : ATL ) handled some 92.4 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[2] in the same templateXLabel[0] . After the reopening of Terminal templateTitle[6] ( the Queen 's Terminal ) on June 4 , 2014 , templateTitle[4] is back to operating five terminals . The U.S. inflation rate for 2018 was templateTitle[0] to be 2.44 percent . templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] Forecast According to data published by the International Monetary Fund , the US templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] ( CPI ) was 224.92 in 2011 , compared to the base period of templateYLabel[3] to templateYLabel[3] . It is templateTitle[0] that the CPI will continue to rise templateXLabel[0] over templateXLabel[0] , reaching 287.51 in templateTitle[10] . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] of all urban consumers in previous years was lower , and has risen every templateXLabel[0] since 1992 , except in 2009 , when the CPI went from 215.30 in 2008 to 214.54 in 2009 . The monthly unadjusted templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] was 255.55 for the month of April in 2019 . The US CPI measures change in the templateYLabel[1] of templateYLabel[0] goods and services purchased by households and a key value in calculating US inflation and the health of the economy . The US Department of Labor 's Bureau of Labor Statistics calculates the CPI and defines it as , `` a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of templateYLabel[0] goods and services . '' The BLS records the templateYLabel[1] of thousands of goods and services month by month . They consider goods and services within eight main categories : food and beverage , housing , apparel , transportation , medical care , recreation , education , and other goods and services . They aggregate the data collected in order to compare how much it would cost a templateYLabel[0] to buy the same market basket of goods and services one month or templateXLabel[0] against how much it cost in a previous month or templateXLabel[0] . Given that the CPI is used to calculate US inflation , the CPI influences the annual adjustments of many financial institutions in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] , both private and public . Wages , social security payments , and pensions are all affected by the CPI .

Additional information on the targets of templateYLabel[2] Although templateYLabel[2] is a worldwide problem , its victims are highly concentrated in certain areas of the world . The most prominent area to have fallen victim to terrorist attacks in recent times has been the region encompassing the Middle East and North Africa . Following military invasions in both Afghanistan and Iraq respectively , the instability brought about templateTitle[7] conflict allowed an opportunity for a templateTitle[4] of terrorist groups to gain a strong foothold in the region . But groups committing terrorist acts are not solely concentrated in the Middle East as shown templateTitle[7] 13 templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] related templateYLabel[3] worldwide in templateTitle[9] occurring in Nigeria . The rise of Boko Haram alongside Islamic State also heavily contributed to the templateTitle[4] of terrorist attacks worldwide increasing considerably in 2014 . templateYLabel[2] attacks such as the bombing of the World Trade Centre in New York on September 11 , 2011 gain the most attention in global media and generally result in increased counter templateYLabel[2] efforts at home and abroad . However , the vast majority of attacks occur in the templateTitle[0] where the major terrorist organizations such as Al Qaeda and Islamic State are based . The lack of security and order present in places like Iraq and Afghanistan affords more opportunities to terrorist groups to commit more obvious acts of templateYLabel[2] including armed assaults , the second most common form of terrorist attack .

Costs of cosmetic procedures in the U.S. Surgical procedures also have varying price points . During a survey in June templateTitle[9] , it was found that just 14 percent of templateTitle[8] adults visited a templateTitle[5] theater one or more times per month , but 46 percent stated that they went to the cinema to watch a templateTitle[5] once or year or less . Another survey earlier in the same year revealed that visits to the cinema can vary according to generation . On average , 34 percent of Gen Xers had seen one templateTitle[5] within the last month , compared to 43 percent of those classed as being members of Generation Z . Meanwhile , Boomers had seen far fewer templateTitle[5] recently than their younger counterparts . Why do n't more people visit templateTitle[5] theaters ? The reticence to templateTitle[2] to cinema to watch a templateTitle[5] could have to do with rising ticket prices in North American templateTitle[5] theaters . Back in 2001 , the average ticket price was 5.66 templateTitle[8] dollars . Five years later in 2006 , this price had risen to 6.55 dollars . In 2018 , a visit to the templateTitle[5] cost 9.11 templateTitle[8] dollars per ticket on average . This means that the cost of seeing a templateTitle[5] has almost doubled in 17 years . Admittedly the increase in price has been gradual , growing by roughly 10 to 50 cents each year , which does n't sound like much . However , for a family of four in 2018 the cost of a trip to the templateTitle[5] could amount to over 35 dollars , and that 's without any trimmings like popcorn , soda or snacks , which moviegoers say they like to buy . Is streaming affecting templateTitle[5] theater attendance ? It has been noted that the growth of entertainment options offered by streaming services could have an effect on whether or not people templateYLabel[0] willing to leave their homes to visit a templateTitle[5] theater . Why leave the house and pay around nine dollars per ticket when you already pay for a streaming subscription and can choose from hundreds of different templateTitle[5] from the comfort of your own couch ? The sheer amount of options on platforms like Netflix make it all too easy for film lovers to decide against templateTitle[2] out and to spend their dollars on subscription upgrades instead of cinema tickets . It 's hard to ignore that times templateYLabel[0] changing and that templateTitle[5] theater attendance may never be what it once was . But , as long as streaming services continue to offer an abundance of films within different genres from all across the world , the templateTitle[5] fans out there will still have a way to engage with film in the way they choose .

Across North America , Europe and Asia Pacific artificial intelligence is templateTitle[0] commonly used in templateTitle[3] data analysis . There templateYLabel[0] some differences between the regions , however , where Asian marketers seem to be more experimental with the use of AI and employ the technology in content creation , whereas North American and European industry professionals tend to utilize AI for automation of templateTitle[3] processes such as personalization , optimization or programmatic advertising . This statistic shows templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[2] from 2010 to 2018 , with projections up until templateTitle[3] .In 2018 , around 3.83 templateYLabel[2] people were employed in templateTitle[2] . templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[2] Just like the rest of templateTitle[2] 's economy , the job market has been adversely affected by the economic crisis of 2008 ; it has been struggling to recover ever since . The majority of the Greek population lives in urbanized areas , but lay-offs and job cuts affect the whole country ; the unemployment rate in templateTitle[2] has been increasing dramatically all over the country and has almost tripled since 2009 . templateTitle[2] 's economy relies heavily on services ; most of templateTitle[2] 's gross domestic product is produced in that sector . The gross domestic / GDP growth rate in templateTitle[2] , however , has not improved since 2009 – on the contrary , after falling to an all-time low in 2011 , GDP is now even lower than in the templateXLabel[0] recession hit the country . Some of the most important industries for templateTitle[2] are the maritime and shipping industries , as well as tourism . The export of goods has been on the rise , while imports have been decreasing , causing the trade deficit to improve slowly but steadily . Still , templateTitle[2] is not out of the red and probably wo n't be for some time . The templateTitle[3] successful figure to date in the history of the Academy Awards is Katharine Hepburn , who won four templateYLabel[2] throughout her acting career . The Academy Awards began in 1929 as a way of celebrating excellence within cinema , and winning an templateYLabel[2] has long been considered prestigious among stars in the movie industry . Who was Katharine Hepburn ? Katharine Hepburn , who died at the age of 96 in 2003 , was a celebrated American actress and Hollywood icon . Hepburn won an templateYLabel[2] for ‘ Best Actress ' for her performance in her first film ‘ Morning Glory ' _ , released in 1933 . The additional three awards came much later in Hepburn 's 66-year movie career . The actress won templateYLabel[2] for ‘ Guess Who 's Coming to Dinner ' and ‘ The Lion in Winter ' in the 1960s , and finally for ‘ On Golden Pond ' at the 54th Academy Awards in 1982 . In addition to her wins , Hepburn received multiple nominations for her work , including for ‘ The African Queen ' where she starred alongside Humphrey Bogart . The actress worked templateTitle[1] several well-known Hollywood stars over the years , including Burt Lancaster , Elizabeth Taylor and Cary Grant . Are the Academy Awards still important today ? Viewership of the templateYLabel[2] has been steadily declining since 2014 . However , media outlets around the world continued to provide extensive and enthusiastic coverage of the event and 2019 nominees Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper made waves on social media . Regardless of viewership figures , for winners , nominees and fans the templateYLabel[2] remain a key part of the film industry and function as a metric of success . As years pass , it is inevitable that those stars templateTitle[1] the templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[2] wins ever will be overtaken by fresh talent . But actresses like Katharine Hepburn will forever be remembered as one of the hallmarks of classic Hollywood cinema , and will continue to be discussed , analyzed and applauded in years to come as fans look back to a bygone era of film . Impressive audience figures or not , that 's something worth celebrating .

templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] ( SO2 ) templateYLabel[2] in the United States have decreased significantly over the last decades . SO2 templateYLabel[2] have fallen to 2.82 million templateYLabel[5] in templateTitle[6] , in comparison to 31.22 million templateYLabel[5] in templateTitle[4] . This reduction in SO2 is largely due to the implementation of the Acid Rain Program under the Clean Air Act through a cap and trade program for fossil-fuel powered plants . What is templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] and how does it impact health and the environment ? SO2 is largely used as an indicator for gaseous templateTitle[1] oxides ( SOx ) as these gases are found in low concentrations in the atmosphere . SO2 is mostly emitted into the atmosphere through the burning of fossil fuels but can also be derived through some industrial processes like extracting metal from ore , operating vehicles and heavy equipment that burn high-sulfur content fuels , and through some natural sources like volcanoes . Exposure to SO2 can negatively impact the respiratory system in humans . High SO2 concentrations can also lead to the formation of other templateTitle[1] oxides which contribute to particulate matter pollution . Environmentally , SO2 can contribute to acid rain and can also damage the growth of plants .

The templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] in the United States amounted to roughly 1.29 trillion templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] in templateTitle[7] . templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] in the United States It is generally the case that in times of austerity people hold on to capital . In the wake of the 2008 financial crisis , this has also been the case . The periods of growth and seeming economic stability in the pre-2008 crisis period were due to falling templateYLabel[3] rates and growing household debt . People were confident the good times would stay and felt comfortable in borrowing money . Interest rates were low and credit was easily accessible and widely available templateTitle[6] these factors encouraged people to spend money . United States consumers pushed growth at home and abroad . According to McKinsey & Company , consumers in the United States have accounted for more than three-quarters of US GDP growth since the templateXLabel[0] 2000 and for more than one-third of worldwide growth in private consumption since 1990 . These trends were fuelled by the surge in household debt and spendthrift . When people change their habits in the opposite direction the economic benefits of consumer spending go into reverse . People start trying to reduce their indebtedness , spend less and save more , consumption inevitably tumbles . An increase in templateYLabel[3] means a decrease in spending , this equates to a serious drag for any economy . The templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] in the United States in 2007 amounted to 296.5 templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] . After the 2008 crisis the templateYLabel[3] increased to over 600 templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] and reached a high of almost 1.3 trillion templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] in 2012 before falling significantly to just over 926 templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] in 2016 templateTitle[6] although templateYLabel[3] rates again climbed to just below 1.3 trillion templateYLabel[6] templateYLabel[7] in templateTitle[7] .

Russian economy The Russian economy is primarily directed by both the private sector and the state . As a member of the BRIC , templateTitle[7] is currently experiencing an accelerated growth within the economy with a chance of earning a place in the G7 economies . As of the 1990s , a large amount of the country 's industrial and agricultural sectors were privatized , however energy and military production remained with the state for the most part . As a result , the majority of Russian exports consisted of energy products as well as high-tech military equipment . The effects of the global financial crisis of 2008 took a similar toll on the Russian economy , however only had short term effects . templateTitle[7] recovered after templateTitle[8] years and has since experienced exponential economical growth and productivity due to aggressive and prompt actions from the government , providing templateTitle[7] with one of the most profitable economies in the world . Additionally , unemployment reached an all-decade low from the recent Russian economic boom , which furthermore implies that there is a slight growth in wages , however is also accompanied by a large worker shortage .

Economy of templateTitle[2] Before the economic crisis started in 2007 , templateTitle[2] 's economy was one of the most thriving in the European Union , but since it was severely hit and officially entered recession in 2009 , gross domestic product / GDP growth in templateTitle[2] has been struggling to recover . The amount of money banks have been lending to templateTitle[2] due to the euro crisis is enormous , but the country still has a long way to go . There is still a vast difference between government revenue and spending in templateTitle[2] , with spending being significantly higher than revenue . Today , a look at a comparison of GDP and national debt in selected euro countries reveals that templateTitle[2] 's GDP is higher than that of other countries which were severely affected by the economic crisis , i.e . Greece , Portugal and Ireland . However , when looking at the national debt in the European Union , templateTitle[2] 's national debt is still one of the highest . The rate of templateYLabel[0] has been decreasing constantly since the crisis , while the unemployment rate in templateTitle[2] has been increasing dramatically and still continues to rise . Just as in other affected countries , many people are losing their jobs while the younger generation graduating from universities are struggling to find templateYLabel[0] . Many are leaving the country in search of work elsewhere . In 2012 , templateTitle[2] introduced a labor reform which is slowly taking effect .

According to quarterly pulse monitors , the growth of templateTitle[0] property templateTitle[3] in the templateTitle[8] is expected to slow down in 2019 and templateTitle[11] . In templateTitle[11] , housing templateTitle[3] are believed to increase with three templateYLabel[3] . This is significantly less than in August 2019 , when templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] grew with approximately 5.7 templateYLabel[3] when compared to the same month a templateXLabel[0] before . The average templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] a house in the templateTitle[8] was approximately 287,000 euros in templateTitle[9] . This templateTitle[4] could templateYLabel[4] quite drastically , though… The source mentions there is a lot of uncertainty whether this prediction will hold true . This has to do with the so-called `` nitrogen decision '' ( in Dutch : stikstofbesluit ) in May 2019 . Simply put , a Dutch advisory body found that the domestic policy templateTitle[4] nitrogen emission ( formally known as Programmatische Aanpak Stikstof or Programmatic Approach Nitrogen ) went against European rules . As of August 2019 , a sizable share of the Dutch population was not familiar with this nitrogen policy . However , the advisory body 's decision led to an immediate stop to all construction in the country ( amongst other things ) . By the end of 2019 , this stop was still in place . How about the housing market in Amsterdam ? Amsterdam , Haarlem and Haarlemmermeer ( two areas surrounding the Dutch capital ) were the cities and/or municipalities with the highest house templateTitle[3] in templateTitle[9] . On average , a house in Amsterdam sold templateTitle[4] over 115,000 euros more than a house in Utrecht . Amsterdam was also well above the average rents found in other cities . A house in Amsterdam had a rent of approximately 23 euros templateYLabel[3] square meter in 2019 , whereas rents in Rotterdam costed roughly 16 euros templateYLabel[3] square meter . It should be noted , however , that rent changes in the Dutch capital are significantly lower than those found in Rotterdam and especially Utrecht .

In templateTitle[4] , 91.49 percent of the total templateYLabel[3] of the templateTitle[3] lived in cities . templateYLabel[3] of the templateTitle[3] The templateTitle[3] is a developed country with a high standard of living . Owing to a fairly steady fertility rate , the total templateYLabel[3] of the templateTitle[3] has only slightly increased over the past decade . A look at the templateYLabel[3] growth in the templateTitle[3] shows that growth has been less than templateTitle[4] percent at some points , and has even decreased to less than 0.5 percent at other intervals over the past few years . templateYLabel[3] density in the templateTitle[3] has increased very slightly accordingly , with the majority of the templateYLabel[3] living in cities , the largest being Amsterdam in terms of residents , closely followed by Rotterdam . The median age of the templateTitle[3] ' templateYLabel[3] ( i.e . one half of the templateYLabel[3] is older , while the other one is younger ) has increased significantly since the 1980s , which is indicative of a high life expectancy among inhabitants . The templateTitle[3] is currently ranked 16th on a ranking of the templateTitle[4] countries with the highest life expectancy worldwide . The templateTitle[3] is also among the countries with the highest GDP in the world , and is thus one of the leading economies . The majority of the workforce is employed in the services sector , generating the majority of gross domestic product . The labor force of the templateTitle[3] consists of more than templateTitle[4] million employed persons , and the unemployment rate has been increasing since the economic crisis in 2008 . The crisis has also been visible in the inflation rate in the templateTitle[3] over the past few years ; on the other hand , trade balance figures show that the Dutch economy has been recovering steadily .

In 2018 , templateTitle[3] 's templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] amounted to around 30.17 percent of the templateYLabel[5] . templateTitle[3] 's economic situation Based on the current state of its economy , templateTitle[3] is defined as an emerging market and one of the newly industrialized countries in the world . templateTitle[3] is identified as one of the members of the G-20 major economies and is also a member of the EU Customs Union , allowing for custom-free trade amongst all member states . Like every other country 's economy , templateTitle[3] 's economy is primarily made up of three different sectors ; agriculture , industry and services . Over the past decade , templateTitle[3] has shifted more focus to its services sector , most notably tourism , communications and transport , while slightly decreasing its dependency on the agricultural and industrial aspects . While many other countries have struggled to recover from the 2008 global financial crisis as well as the Eurozone crisis , the Turkish economy returned to its pre-crisis form in several years and has since seen exponential economic growth and higher productivity and efficiency , more than double the amount compared to a decade prior . With regards to total templateYLabel[5] , government spending within the country has remained relatively low and has remained stable over the past decade , in comparison to developed EU countries , which may be spending more than they can afford .

The statistic shows the total templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[4] and templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] in Indonesian territorial waters from templateTitle[9] to templateTitle[11] . In templateTitle[11] , there were 25 templateTitle[4] and templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] in templateTitle[0] . templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] in templateTitle[0] templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] in Indonesian waters spiked in 2015 , when 108 templateYLabel[2] were reported . templateTitle[0] of the most obvious reasons why Southeast Asia 's largest economy has come under threat from maritime crime is the region 's abundance in natural gas and petroleum resources : In 2018 , templateTitle[0] was ranked among the world 's largest exporting countries of liquefied natural gas.Moreover , templateTitle[0] 's other main export categories include electronic equipment , electrical appliances and garments . The merchant ships that carry these commodities and consumer goods may need to navigate through templateTitle[0] of the world 's narrowest chokepoints : the Strait of Malacca . Predominantly a strategic passage for petroleum and natural gas transport , this trade route is also frequented by ocean freight haulers moving goods from the Persian Gulf to Japan , South Korea and China . As a result , the sea around the archipelago has become a prime target for armed robbery at sea , and recently the pirates have become increasingly successful in outsmarting naval forces by expanding their hunting grounds and moving towards open waters in the east or the along Sumatra 's fragmented coastline in the south . Due to the pirates ' good organization and versatility , templateYLabel[2] of maritime crime off the Indonesian coast increased sevenfold from 2009 to 2013 . The surge in pirate templateTitle[8] may trigger increased presence by the military forces of affected nations . After all , the costs of templateTitle[7] inevitably result in higher insurance costs faced by forwarders , rising fuel costs due to higher speed in order to escape the criminals , ransom sums , as well as the growing outlays in wages and salary that need to be paid to armed personnel on ships .

The aging templateTitle[5] The templateXLabel[0] 2035 is expected to be a turning point for the templateTitle[5] of the United States . This is the templateXLabel[0] that demographers expect there to be more adults over the templateYLabel[1] of 65 than children . Additionally , in the templateXLabel[0] 2060 , there are expected to be about 604,000 people aged 100 and over in the templateTitle[4] . This figure was around 72,000 in 2015 . The aging templateTitle[5] in the United States means that society is going to have to find a way to adapt to the larger numbers of older people . Everything from Social Security to employment to the templateYLabel[1] of retirement will have to change if the templateTitle[5] is expected to templateYLabel[1] more while having fewer children . The world is getting older It 's not only the United States that is facing this particular demographic dilemma . In 1950 , the global templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] was 23.6 templateYLabel[3] . This number is projected to increase to 41.6 templateYLabel[3] by the templateXLabel[0] 2100 . In the first half of 2016 , a total of 31 deepwater oil discoveries were made . Nevertheless , they are more expensive to develop than shallow water deposits and in the wake of the oil glut , many templateYLabel[2] oil projects have ceased to be viable . Many oil companies have decreased their templateYLabel[2] drilling activity significantly , and oil platform decommissioning activity has increased . The insurance templateXLabel[0] templateXLabel[1] Independer.nl was also a familiar name . Noticeable , however , is the low familiarity among Dutch consumers of relatively big templateXLabel[1] , such as HoyHoy and Easyswitch . According to the source this has to do with a certain distrust : templateYLabel[0] these templateXLabel[1] actually independent and templateYLabel[0] they offering the best deal possible ? This potential distrust in online companies is not uncommon in the templateTitle[5] and can also be seen , for example , in the level of ( dis ) trust the Dutch have towards social media . Dutch online shoppers : all about the money Despite this skepticism towards the independence of price templateXLabel[0] templateXLabel[1] , Dutch consumers did believe price to be the most deciding factor when buying products online in 2018 . They even valued it over free delivery or the name of a specific brand . Delivery speed , specifically same-day delivery , was also not a priority . This is because an Amazon Prime model does not yet exist on a large scale in the templateTitle[5] , unlike other countries in Europe . Amazon ( and Amazon Prime ) is available in the templateTitle[5] but only have a small market templateYLabel[0] compared to domestic companies as the e-commerce giant only sells books through a partially translated part of Amazon.de . In early 2020 , however , Amazon will launch a full Dutch templateXLabel[1] . Made in the templateTitle[5] or made in China ? A preference for low prices and a willingness to accept a longer delivery speed might explain why the Dutch tend to buy their products from China . Slightly more than one third of the population in the templateTitle[5] had bought something from a Chinese templateXLabel[1] shop as of 2018 . Indeed , the AliExpress app was the second most-used e-commerce app in the templateTitle[5] at the end of 2018 .

More about templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] is one of the leading banks in the European market in terms of tier templateTitle[7] capital . It is also the leading bank in France in terms of market capitalization . Why is templateTitle[0] of templateYLabel[1] important ? The templateTitle[0] of templateYLabel[1] at a company can serve as a proxy for the physical size of its operations . While ATMs and internet interfaces have reduced the need for personal interaction with customers , banks still need analysts , financial planners , accountants , and lawyers . As such , comparing the workforce of templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] to other leading banks can give an idea as to the extent of its global activities .

In the templateYLabel[2] , it made the 21th templateYLabel[3] . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] – what does it express ? In general , the templateYLabel[2] created by the International Federation of Association templateTitle[6] ( templateYLabel[0] ) is based on game results and the most successful templateTitle[7] is ranked highest . As of August 2018 , a new calculation model adapted from the Elo rating system is in use , which is known in many sports . The teams get points for single games , that are determined by the relative strength of both opponents . These points must be added/ subtracted to get the final templateYLabel[3] in the templateYLabel[2] . In 2015 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is expected to be 881.65 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] Over the years humans converted grasslands to templateYLabel[0] areas , this allows food for humans . It is obvious that the rising number of people living on earth forces us to cultivate crops that need not to be replanted after each harvest , such as cocoa and coffee . The cocoa bean is used as the base for chocolate and many other chocolate products . The templateTitle[1] cocoa production grew steadily from around 1.67 templateYLabel[3] tons during templateYLabel[0] templateXLabel[0] 1980 and 1981 up to 4.3 templateYLabel[3] tons of produced cocoa in templateYLabel[0] templateXLabel[0] 2010 and 2011 . Chocolate made in Switzerland is famous all over the world and the Swiss population leads the ranking of the per capita consumption of chocolate products . In 2011 , 10.55 kilogram of chocolate products were consumed by Swiss people , based on average . The worldwide coffee production has also increased from 103.91 templateYLabel[3] bags in 2003 to 145.78 templateYLabel[3] produced bags in 2013 . Fair trade coffee is becoming increasingly popular in the United States . The United States imported more than 163.01 templateYLabel[3] pounds of fair trade coffee in templateXLabel[0] 2012 . The imports have been growing rapidly since 1999 . In contrast to that , only 2.05 templateYLabel[3] pounds of fair trade coffee were imported in templateXLabel[0] 1999 . The brewed beverage made of roasted coffee beans is an evergreen in most peoples ' morning routine . The Netherlands is the top leading coffee consumer country in 2013 with an average per capita consumption of 2.41 cups per day .

Despite a jump in unemployment after the global recession hit in 2008 , rates were almost back to pre-recession rates by 2013 . Another factor affecting templateTitle[3] is the number of emigrants to other countries . As of the fourth templateXLabel[0] of templateTitle[6] , templateTitle[0] had 124 templateYLabel[3] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[1] worldwide , up from 96 templateYLabel[3] in the corresponding templateXLabel[0] of 2018 . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[1] base has increased dramatically in the last few years , more than doubling in just three years . templateTitle[0] and competitors templateTitle[0] is a music streaming service originally founded in 2006 in Sweden . The platform can be used from various devices and allows users to browse through a catalogue of music licensed through multiple record labels , as well as creating and sharing playlists with other users . Additionally , listeners are able to enjoy music for free with advertisements or are also given the option to purchase a subscription to allow for unlimited ad-free music streaming . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] largest competitors are Pandora , a company that offers a similar service , and Apple Music which was launched in templateTitle[4] . Pandora is the highest-grossing music app title in the Apple App Store and often generates over templateTitle[4] templateYLabel[3] U.S. dollars in revenue each month . Users are also able to register templateTitle[0] accounts using Facebook directly through the website using an app . What is templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] ? According to the FBI , templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] is defined as `` sexual penetration , no matter how slight , with a body part or object without the consent of the victim . '' This definition changed in 2013 from the previous definition , which specified `` carnal knowledge of a female victim forcibly and against her will . '' Attempted templateTitle[4] was included in the previous definition , but statutory templateTitle[4] and other sexual offenses were excluded . The old definition was seen as problematic , as people of any gender can be raped . Since the revision of the definition of templateTitle[4] , templateTitle[2] rapes increased by about templateTitle[8] percent , although it is not clear if this is due to the revised definition or if the templateYLabel[0] itself has increased . templateTitle[4] in the United States While templateTitle[4] and sexual assault have been extensively talked about in the U.S. in recent years , especially since the start of the # metoo movement , there is still a large number of sexual offences committed each templateXLabel[0] . Building materials in the United States : templateTitle[1] After its tremendous downturn following the 2008 subprime mortgage crisis , the housing industry in the United States is making a comeback , especially in markets like New York , Dallas and Houston . templateYLabel[0] & P/Case Shiller 's national home price index for the United States was expected to grow to some 205 points in 2018 , up from around 128 points in 2011 , the worst templateXLabel[0] for US housing in half a decade . As a result , building material manufacturers templateYLabel[3] trying to tap into the market and have begun to raise prices dramatically . Thus , homebuilders templateYLabel[3] faced with increasing costs of building materials . Major companies involved in building materials include the United States Gypsum Corporation , Lafarge and Wacker . templateTitle[1] , which is also known as drywall , plasterboard or gypsum templateTitle[1] , is a panel made of gypsum plaster . The panel is usually sandwiched between two thick sheets of paper to make interior templateTitle[1] and ceilings . templateTitle[1] construction is prevalent in North America in comparison to the traditional usage of lath and plaster due to quicker application . Some 42 templateYLabel[2] metric tons of gypsum was consumed in the templateTitle[0] in templateTitle[6] . The rise in prices is believed to be driven by increased building activity and demand from home improvement retailers . In the long run , expensive construction materials templateYLabel[3] set to have an impact on property prices , too . At 326,400 US dollars , the templateTitle[0] median house price of new homes sold in the US has increased steadily over the last decades .

An expensive social security system A social security system is meant to help individuals and families deal with unexpected accidents and losses , invest in health and education and protect the elderly . The Italian social security system is public and based on compulsory contributions made by taxpayers and managed by the State . Depending on several factors , ranging from the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[0] of retirement to the generosity of the benefits paid , social security can be very costly for the State . In 2016 , in templateTitle[0] there were over 16 million pensioners ( 654677 ) , defined as an individual who receives at least one type of templateYLabel[2] benefit ( 806281 ) , and the public expenditure for pensions reached over 280 billion templateYLabel[5] , which amounted to approximately templateTitle[8] percent of the Country 's GDP . The increasing popularity of templateYLabel[2] funds Alongside the public social security system , templateYLabel[2] funds based on voluntary contributions by private members can provide a safety net for those who want to receive a supplementary benefit . Despite being far from reaching the values registered in other countries such as the United Kingdom , the Netherlands and Germany in terms of assets , the popularity of templateYLabel[2] funds is growing in templateTitle[0] . In fact , the templateYLabel[3] of voluntary templateYLabel[2] funds ' contributions in templateTitle[0] increased from 6.8 billion templateYLabel[5] in 2007 to 10.4 billion templateYLabel[5] in templateTitle[8] .

Natural disasters Natural disasters , such as earthquakes , volcanic eruption , tsunamis , floods , tornados or templateTitle[6] affect people templateTitle[7] . templateTitle[6] typically occur during periods of heavy rainfall or rapid snowmelt and basically appear in regions which are likely to have monsoon storm . The templateYLabel[0] of people affected by templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] stood at 4,000,000 due to the templateXLabel[0] in Brazil in January 11 , 1966 . Compared to Brazil , India counted 2,500,000 affected people in July , 1986 . Earthquakes are typically caused by the movement of the earth crusts , these movements cause vibrations which pass through and around the templateTitle[7] . Earthquakes often destroy the homes of many people and cause a lot of casualties . The global templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] due to earthquakes varies templateTitle[4] year to year . As a templateTitle[3] of earthquakes , 320,120 people died templateTitle[7] in 2010 and about 768 people died in 2012 . Tropical cyclones are a rotating system of clouds and thunderstorm and although there are tropical cyclone warning systems the tropical cyclone in the Philippines was the natural disaster with the most fatalities in 2012 , 1,901 people lost their lives due to the tropical cyclone . It is always a big tragedy when people are affected by natural disasters , 1,036,065 affected people were counted during the volcanic eruption in the Philippines in June 9 , 1991 . Most of the states which know about the volcanic activities in their countries have an evacuation plan trying to safe peoples lives . In some cases it is difficult for the people to follow authorities ' instructions caused by unforeseen situations and it comes to high templateYLabel[0] of casualties like in the volcanic eruption in Ecuador in August 14 , 2006 .

A slowly recovering marketHomeownership in templateTitle[4] reached 72.4 percent in 2017 , one of the highest rates in Western Europe . Low templateYLabel[1] rates , especially when compared to other European countries , and decreasing house prices led to a renewed templateYLabel[1] in the real estate market in templateTitle[4] . Despite not reaching the pre-crisis levels , an increase in the number of transactions in the residential real estate market as well as the volume of mortgages stipulated for house purchase indicate a positive trend for the sector in templateTitle[4] . Milan , an attractive destination for investments In recent years more than in the past , thanks to its role as a capital of business and finance as well as an innovation hub , Milan was able to attract human capital and investments , both domestic and foreign . This ability to grow and innovate was also reflected in the real estate market , which was the most dynamic in the country . Transactions in residential real estate in Milan increased steadily since 2012 and so did prices : some areas of the city are among the most expensive in the country to buy a property .

Future development of Chinese populationThe Chinese templateTitle[0] will soon reach a maximum size and then begin to shrink gradually . However , the exact templateXLabel[0] for this turning point is unclear . Whereas IMF estimates see it coming in the first half of the 2020s , Chinese demographers expect a later date around 2030 . Gun ownership in the templateTitle[4] . Possession of firearms in the United States is protected templateTitle[7] the 2nd Amendment of the Constitution and has been a defining aspect of American civil liberties since the writing of the Bill of Rights . It is estimated that the United States has the highest rate of civilian-owned firearms in the world , and Americans continually poll against handgun restrictions . templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] However , with high gun ownership comes high responsibility . The United States consistently faces numerous templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] each year , particularly in schools . Additional information on templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] The global templateYLabel[1] has risen dramatically in the last 100 years from 1.65 templateYLabel[3] in 1900 to surpassing 7 templateYLabel[3] in 2011 . The most significant driver of this templateYLabel[1] change has been the reduction of global mortality rates . Scientific research and well organized health policy implementation have ensured that epidemics such as the HIV/AIDS epidemic can be combated more effectively to save the lives of those at risk . Declining infant mortality rates are a triumphant example of health improvements , especially in North Africa and the Middle East . Infant mortality rates have also declined in more economically developed countries such as the United States . China and India are now the most populous countries in the templateYLabel[0] , together accounting for over one third of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] . Recent trends suggest these countries will continue to have high fertility rates until they reach a higher level of economic templateTitle[3] . The trend of fertility rates below 2.1 per women , the rate considered to be necessary to retain the templateYLabel[1] level , is evident in developed countries such as Singapore . However , countries such as Singapore can retain their templateYLabel[1] level through increased immigration rather than increasing fertility rates . Some critics have argued that the issue of templateYLabel[1] rise should regain a prominent place in the international political agenda . Recent studies including a 2014 study at the University of Washington have placed doubt on the claim that the global templateYLabel[1] will peak at 9 templateYLabel[3] around 2050 . The issue is important as growing populations place higher strain on both natural and public resources including healthcare and education .

Why does social media fuel or help to spread templateYLabel[7] templateYLabel[8] ? The templateTitle[4] joined the templateTitle[6] in 1988 in templateTitle[3] as an expansion team , but had limited success in its first seasons . In the mid 1990s however , it became a serious championship contender under the management of head coach Pat Riley . The team won its first templateTitle[6] championship series in 2006 , and then again in 2012 and 2013 . Although it is a relative young team , with many ups and downs it its short history , the templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] have gained a considerable following in the past decade . In a ranking of templateTitle[6] teams according to the number of fans on Facebook , the templateTitle[4] placed fourth , with over templateTitle[9] million fans . This number places them ahead of more established teams with a rich history in the leagues , such as rivals Boston Celtics or New York Knicks , both established in 1946 . The team has had on its roster some of the most famous basketball players of all times , such as Shaquille O'Neal and Alonzo Mourning , as well as the so-called `` Big 3 '' - Chris Bosh , LeBron James and Dwyane Wade , which raised to stardom during the team 's run to the 2012 and 2013 championships . How many templateYLabel[0] Bowls have been won templateYLabel[0] templateXLabel[0] ? The New England Patriots have won the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] six times , most recently templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] LIII in February 2019 . Joining them at the top of this list is the Pittsburgh Steelers , whose most recent of their six titles came in 2009 . The franchise 's most successful period came between 1975 and 1980 , during which they claimed the title four times . The history of the big game The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is the annual championship game of the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] ( NFL ) , pitting the champions of the NFL 's two conferences ( AFC and NFC ) against each other . The games were originally created as part of a merger agreement between the American templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] ( AFL ) and the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] , with the first templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] being played on January 15 , 1967 , following the 1966 templateTitle[1] season . To identify the games , successive Roman numerals are used leading templateYLabel[0] to the most recent templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in 2014 ( templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] XLVIII ) . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] greats With six championships templateYLabel[2] each , the Pittsburgh Steelers and the New England Patriots are the most successful NFL franchises in terms of templateYLabel[0] Bows won . Of these two teams , the New England Patriots are the most recent champions , defeating the Los Angeles Rams in templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] LIII in 2019 with a score of 13 - 3 . Winning templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] LIII made Tom Brady the player with the most templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] rings as players with a record setting sixth templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] . Charles Haley , who played from 1986 to 1999 , has the second-most templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] rings with five . Notable players who have won four templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] rings are Joe Montana , Bill Romanowski , Adam Vinatieri , Ronnie Lott , Matt Millen and Terry Bradshaw . In templateTitle[9] , Patrick Mahomes joined the illustrious list of quarterbacks to have won a templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] ring . Having been 10 - templateTitle[9] down to the San Francisco 49ers in the final quarter , the Kansas City Chiefs scored 21 unanswered points to claim their first templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] victory in 50 years . Legendary quarterbacks While Tom Brady is certainly a legend of the game , he does not top the list of quarterbacks with the most passing yards in NFL history . This honor belongs to fellow quarterback legend , Drew Brees , who has thrown a total of over 74 thousand yards in his career . However , Brady is the undoubted master of the playoffs , having won a total of 30 playoff games during his career , almost double that of his closest rival on the list , Joe Montana . The Patriots quarterback is also peerless when it comes to total passing yards for the franchise – his over-70,000 yards are more than double those of Drew Bledsoe , who occupies second place on the Patriots ' all-time list .

The first official smartphones came onto the market in the early 1990s . Initially a templateYLabel[0] was classified by its ability to offer features like e-mail capability , internet access , QUERTY keyboards , personal digital assistant functions and perhaps a built-in camera . As of today , smartphones have progressed even more and we typically classify smartphones as having a high definition touchscreen , various apps , navigation tools and high-speed internet on the go . More recently sales of smartphones have even exceeded that of traditional feature phones as templateYLabel[0] usage has continued to rise .

The templateTitle[5] templateYLabel[0] - additional information The wearable technology industry is a new and expanding templateYLabel[0] , with rapidly growing revenues and innovative new players entering the templateYLabel[0] . The revenue of the templateTitle[4] wearables templateYLabel[0] stood at almost 1.5 billion U.S. dollars in templateTitle[7] and is expected to grow to 5.8 billion U.S. dollars in 2018 . Wearable products include templateTitle[5] glasses , hearables , templateTitle[5] health devices , templateTitle[5] watches and fitness trackers or even templateTitle[5] jewelry and clothing . Smartwatches templateYLabel[1] devices worn around the wrist that feature a vast array of functions , aside from time-telling . They can collect data from the wearer 's body or environment , such as heart rate , calorie consumption , and blood pressure or outside temperature . Additionally , they can connect via Bluetooth to a smartphone and perform a number of actions , like GPS navigation or video-calling . According to forecasts , almost 25 million smartwatches will be sold in 2015 worldwide , 7.4 million units in North America alone . The revenue of templateTitle[5] sales is predicted to reach 3.1 billion U.S. dollars in the United States in 2015 . As of 2015 , the leader of the templateTitle[5] templateYLabel[0] is Samsung . Other important players templateYLabel[1] Pebble , Fitbit , Sony , Lenovo and LG . With the introduction of the Apple templateTitle[5] at the beginning of 2015 , Apple is expected to also become a strong competitor in the near future . A total of 89 templateTitle[0] debuted templateTitle[5] watches in templateTitle[7] and many more templateYLabel[1] expected to bring smartwatches to the templateYLabel[0] in 2015 .

The problem of youth templateYLabel[0] is a direct result of the marked reduction in the number of entry-level jobs in the labor market in the past few decades . The global templateYLabel[1] As shown above , the total number of people living on Earth has more than doubled since the 1950s , and continues to increase . A look at the templateTitle[0] of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] since the beginning of the Common Era shows that such a surge in numbers is unprecedented . The first significant rise in templateYLabel[1] occurred during the 14th century , after the Black Death had killed approximately 25 million people worldwide . Subsequently , the global templateYLabel[1] increased slowly but steadily templateTitle[5] it reached record numbers between 1950 and 2000 . The majority of the global templateYLabel[1] lives on the Asian continent , as a statistic of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] by continent shows . In around 100 years , it is estimated that templateYLabel[1] levels on the African continent will have reached similar levels to those we see in Asia today . As for a forecast of the templateTitle[0] of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] , the figures are estimated to have reached more than 10 templateYLabel[3] by the 22nd century . Growing templateYLabel[1] numbers pose an increasing risk to the planet , since rocketing numbers equal increased consumption of food and resources . Scientists worry that natural resources , such as oil , and food resources will become scarce , endangering the human race and , even more so , the templateYLabel[0] 's ecosystem . Nowadays , the number of undernourished / starving people worldwide has decreased slightly , but forecasts paint a darker picture .

The templateTitle[2] age templateTitle[2] or templateTitle[2] financing has its roots in the American website ArtistShare , which was founded in the early 2000s . The idea and concept of crowd-sourced fundraising – the collective effort of individuals to pool together money online to support the efforts of individuals or organizations ' - had already proved itself to be a worthwhile idea . It was not unheard of prior to this that music fans would pool together money in order to support bands and musicians on their tours . After the initial pioneering stage of ArtistShare other templateTitle[3] began to appear and the templateTitle[2] sector started to show strong signs of growth , in the United States initially and then in Europe . The direction of growth is cementing itself with each year that passes ; growth in the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] in templateTitle[5] was up 60 percent in 2011 , a stark rise in the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[3] has resulted in an increased templateTitle[2] volume , 2.8 billion U.S. dollars in templateTitle[5] . templateTitle[2] has been able to provide a means of access to templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] some enthusiastic entrepreneurs ' whose ideas have pleased the templateTitle[2] . In the age of austerity and financial uncertainty , some see the role of such templateTitle[2] organizations as positive . Many banks in a templateYLabel[0] of countries are reluctant to make capital loans to small businesses , sparking accusations among some that lenders are failing to lend their support to a key potential area of economic growth . While the motivation behind the donations made is often unclear , it is a positive sign that people are willing to donate money to worth while causes in which they see a degree of merit .

Around 9,624 people died worldwide in templateTitle[7] as a result of earthquakes . Earthquakes Earthquakes are typically caused by the movement of the templateTitle[1] crusts . These movements cause vibrations which pass through and around the world . templateTitle[1] Early Warning systems use seismic networks to detect earthquakes very rapidly so that these warnings can protect peoples ' lives . Nevertheless , an templateTitle[1] may cause injury and templateYLabel[0] . According to the U.S. Geological Survey , over 316,000 people were killed in the templateTitle[1] in Haiti in 2010 . With a total number of 3,000 killed people , the templateTitle[1] in San Francisco on April 18 , 1906 is the templateTitle[1] that caused the most fatalities within the United States . The number of fatalities includes people killed by earthquakes and resulting fires in San Francisco . The templateTitle[0] number of deaths due to earthquakes varies templateTitle[4] templateXLabel[0] to templateXLabel[0] . In 2010 , about 320,120 people died as a result of earthquakes worldwide . In 2012 earthquakes only caused 768 fatalities . The world 's strongest templateTitle[1] in the time period templateTitle[4] 1990 and 2013 , according to measurement in the Richter scale , was the templateTitle[1] in Chile in 1960 . With a magnitude of 9.5 this templateTitle[1] is the highest ranked templateTitle[1] . The Richter scale helps to quantify the energy released by an templateTitle[1] . The magnitude of 9.0 and higher is defined as ‘ Near or at total destruction - severe damage or collapse to all buildings . Heavy damage and shaking extends to distant locations . International transactions statistics cover the foreign affiliates ' transactions with their templateYLabel[4] parents , so these statistics focus on the templateYLabel[4] parent 's share , or interest , in its affiliates rather than on the affiliates ' overall size or level of operations . The major items include capital flows , which measure the funds that templateYLabel[4] parents provide to their foreign affiliates , and income , which measures the return on those funds . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateTitle[2] statistics are stocks and are cumulative ; they measure the total outstanding level of templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] abroad at templateXLabel[0] end .

The present day meaning of templateTitle[3] has evolved templateYLabel[1] a traditional clothes packing medium into a more comfortable , convenient and multi-purposeful travel-companion . templateTitle[3] has now become a part of travel apparel which defines personality of the traveler . Nowadays , apart templateYLabel[1] clothes , templateTitle[3] bags include shoes , laptops , cameras as well as other related electronic accessories , food items , water bottles , and business files.The global templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] was estimated to generate templateTitle[7] close to 21 billion U.S. dollars in templateYLabel[2] . The travel bag segment was responsible for around 44 percent of templateTitle[3] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] as of 2016 . The rising global economy and increasing per capita income are some of the key drivers of the global templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] . The templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] can be segmented into three major categories , namely casual bag , travel bag , and business bag . These categories can be further fragmented into backpacks , computer bags , wheel bags , business carry-on tool bags , and sports bags . The casual bag segment , which includes backpacks and wheel bags , is the fastest-growing segment.Samsonite is one the templateTitle[8] templateTitle[5] largest travel goods players . In templateYLabel[2] , the total revenue of Samsonite was around 3.8 billion U.S. dollars ; with 35 percent of its net templateTitle[7] being generated templateTitle[13] its Asian templateXLabel[0] . The top four players of the industry are ACE , Samsonite , Tumi , and VF Corp. although there are several emerging players in developing countries , who operate at the local level .

CPI templateTitle[7] Although the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] is a commonly utilized templateYLabel[1] indicator , the templateTitle[11] also uses a newer method of calculating templateYLabel[1] , the Consumer templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] . The CPI typically has a lower templateYLabel[1] rate than that of the templateYLabel[0] , which is reflected in the CPI templateTitle[7] . By templateTitle[15] templateTitle[7] example , the CPI templateYLabel[1] rate is expected to be two percent , compared with the templateYLabel[0] templateTitle[7] of 4.2 percent . Which one is correct ? The CPI is used as the official templateYLabel[1] statistic by the templateTitle[11] government in most cases , but the templateYLabel[0] is still used in certain instances . Increases in rail fares are calculated using the templateYLabel[0] templateTitle[7] example , while increase in pension payments are calculated using CPI . The use of one templateYLabel[1] measure over the other can therefore have a significant impact on people 's lives in the templateTitle[11] .

Energy in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[5] uses a diverse range of fuels to generate energy . Nuclear plays a significant role in the Hungarian energy mix , with energy derived from nuclear sources making up half of the country 's energy mix as of 2017 . During 2016 , when nuclear accounted templateTitle[2] 51.3 percent of the country 's energy mix , the country generated two gigawatts of energy from nuclear sources . templateTitle[5] 's capacity to generate energy from renewable sources has increased significantly in recent years , climbing from 582 megawatts in 2008 , to 1,522 megawatts in 2018 . In a ranking of templateYLabel[1] to GDP per country , templateTitle[3] is currently ranked second . templateTitle[3] 's struggle after the financial crisis templateTitle[3] is a developed country in the EU and is highly dependent on its service sector as well as its tourism sector in order to gain profits . After going through a large economic boom from the 1950s to the 1970s as well as somewhat high GDP growth in the early to mid 2000s , templateTitle[3] 's economy took a turn for the worse and struggled intensively , primarily due to the Great Recession , the Euro crisis as well as its own templateYLabel[1] crisis . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] within the country saw significant gains over the past decades , however roughly came to a halt due to financial rescue packages issued from the European Union in order to help templateTitle[3] maintain and improve their economical situation . The templateYLabel[0] 's continuous rise in templateYLabel[1] has overwhelmed its estimated GDP over the years , which can be attributed to poor government execution and unnecessary spending . Large sums of financial aid were taken from major European banks to help balance out these government-induced failures and to potentially help refuel the economy to encourage more spending , which in turn would decrease the country 's continuously rising unemployment rate . Investors , consumers and workers alike are struggling to see a bright future in templateTitle[3] , whose chances of an economic comeback are much lower than that of other struggling countries such as Portugal and Italy . However , templateTitle[3] 's financial situation might improve in the future , as it is estimated that at least its templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] will decrease - slowly , but steadily . Still , since its future participation in the European Union is in limbo as of now , these figures can only be estimates , not predictions .
