Dropping mineral prices affect templateTitle[7] 's economy The economy of templateTitle[7] is still strong and the prospect of significant future growth still remains , but overall templateTitle[4] appears to be waning after a period of significant growth which took place between 2010 and 2013 . The annual growth rate of Peruvian templateTitle[4] was as high as 8.45 percent in 2010 . Yet , the annual growth rate for 2014 was only a quarter of that , and future growth rates are expected to linger at around templateTitle[8] percent . Much of this earlier growth can be attributed to the country 's mineral wealth in copper , silver , lead , zinc , oil and gold , but over the years , the price of many of these minerals has been on a decline . The price of many of these mineral resources began to decline in 2011 , some decreasing significantly in price and others less so . The copper price has decreased , as has the price of lead and gold . The price of silver dropped significantly , too , and the impact of falling oil prices is being felt around the world . Zinc is the only aforementioned mineral whose price has remained stable . As the economy of templateTitle[7] is directly linked to these resources and industry composes close to a 40 percent share of templateTitle[4] , it is no wonder the economy of templateTitle[7] has been impacted .
As of templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] , templateTitle[8] , the outbreak of the coronavirus disease ( templateTitle[0] ) had spread to six continents , and approximately 3,000 people had died after contracting the respiratory virus . The majority of the confirmed cases were located in China , where around 2,900 templateYLabel[2] had been reported . WHO raises global risk level Approximately 60 countries templateTitle[2] have been affected templateTitle[10] the virus . The risk of infection is serious if you are in an area where there are confirmed cases , and the templateTitle[2] Health Organization ( WHO ) has raised the global risk of the outbreak to very high . Most people can continue to go about their daily life as normal , but if you have recently traveled to an affected area or been in close contact with someone with the virus , you should seek medical advice and templateXLabel[0] to stay away from public places . What are the symptoms of the virus ? It can take up to 14 days for symptoms of the illness to start being noticed . The most commonly reported symptoms are a fever and a dry cough , leading to shortness of breath . The early symptoms are similar to other viruses common at this time of year , such as the common cold and flu – these illnesses spread more during cold months , but it is not yet known whether or not temperature impacts the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus . Once again , medical advice should be sought if you are experiencing any of these symptoms .

Nevertheless , this trend was abruptly reverted during the first templateXLabel[0] of the Hollande Presidency : the templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] jumped from 2,657 in 2012 to 3,192 in 2013 . The templateYLabel[0] of Public templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[2] have increased during Hollande 's presidency During the first templateXLabel[0] of the former French president François Hollande Presidency , the templateYLabel[0] of publicly owned templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[2] also increased at an abrupt pace , going from 928 in 2012 to 1,458 templateYLabel[2] in 2013 . However , the templateYLabel[0] of individuals employed in the public health system or in all templateYLabel[2] increased only slightly during the first three years of Hollande 's Presidency , going from around 1,298 thousand employees in 2013 to 1.3 million in 2015 . The French Public Health System covers much of the per capita health expenses In 2019 , the French Health System accounted for a small fraction of the public budget . In fact , only around 1,4 billion euros were destined to public health , compared to 44 billion euros allocated to for Defense . Yet , the health spending per capita in templateTitle[2] is one of the highest among other develop countries . According to templateTitle[5] figures , around 4,600 U.S. dollars were spent per person in healthcare , of which 3,626 U.S. dollars were covered by the public health system .

The statistic shows templateYLabel[1] templateXLabel[0] of templateTitle[1] templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] templateXLabel[0] templateTitle[6] in templateTitle[7] . Total templateYLabel[1] templateTitle[1] templateXLabel[0] were 1.4 billion templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in 2011/2012.Hair Care Products MarketHair care is a dynamic and complex market , driven by the fundamental fact that people are always looking for hair that is more beautiful , healthier and easier to style . Consumers look for brands and products that meet their needs emotionally , delivering on the desire to have beautiful hair and functionally , to combat common hair problems . They frequently look for new products to address their hair concerns or to achieve a desired look . Shoppers want efficacious , technology-driven beauty products that deliver results.Innovation is critical in the hair category because consumers , predominantly women , have an evolving cycle of hair concerns and are constantly changing their hairstyle . This is an exciting time for the hair care category . The segment is always evolving as personal care manufacturers continue to introduce new offerings that meet consumer needs . In recent years , the hair care category has evolved from an industry dominated by monolithic mega-brands offering something for everyone to brands and products with customized solutions and ranges that address their unique needs . In the past , consumers had to visit a salon or specialty store for personalized hair care products , but today they can easily find tailored hair care solutions at grocery , drug and mass retailers .

In 2016 , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] of templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] amounted to approximately 4 billion templateYLabel[1] dollars.Jewelry Retail Market WorldwideThe templateTitle[0] jewelry industry seems poised for a glittering future as consumer appetite for jewelry , which was dampened by the templateTitle[0] recession , now appears more voracious than ever . The jewlery market is personified by stifling competition . The sector sways between inexpensive jewelry pieces for daily wear , to special items like engagement rings and watches meant for celebrating special events , to investment pieces priced and sold similarly to antique pieces and fine art.Tiffany templateTitle[5] Company is one of the leading competitors in the jewelry retail industry . The merchandise offerings include jewelry , timepieces , sterling silverware , china , crystal , stationery , fragrances and accessories . In 2016 , templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] generated templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] of about 4 billion templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] worldwide . Fashion jewelry was the company 's most engrossing product segment , generating about 1.7 billion templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in 2015 . templateTitle[4] has adopted multiple direct distribution channels . This strategy has enabled the company to emerge as a prominent player in the jewelry and specialty retailer segment.Tiffany is one of the leading brand names in the fine jewelry market and as a result , is one of the world 's premier jewelry designers and retailers . `` Money makes the world go round , '' goes the refrain of a song from the 1972 musical movie , Cabaret . Just as this was true for Sally Bowles , the character played by Liza Minnelli , it is also the driving influence of the jewelry market . Personal income and the growing number of working women since 2009 has led to impressive growth , thus expanding the boundaries of its existing realm .

NATO and the two percent pledge The templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] is a founding member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization ( NATO ) a military and political alliance initiated on the principle that an attack on one member is an attack on all . Members of NATO are expected to spend at least two percent of their Gross-Domestic Product on templateTitle[4] , a target which the templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] just missed between 2015/16 and 2017/18 when it was 1.9 percent . Prior to 2016 the templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] 's templateTitle[4] spending was always above this target and was higher than three percent of GDP before the mid-1990s . This statistic depicts the templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] against ships templateTitle[4] from templateTitle[5] through templateTitle[7] . There were 162 such incidents in templateTitle[7] . templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] Although the term `` templateYLabel[2] '' may conjure up images of bearded men with eye patches , wooden legs and parrots who were convicted and buried centuries ago , templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] are indeed posing a threat to today 's shipping lines all over the templateTitle[4] . Contemporary maritime piracy reached its peak level in templateTitle[5] , with around 445 reported incidents . The regions most likely to come under threat from templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] include Indonesia , the Malaysia , and Nigeria . Here , pirates are attracted by the abundance of natural resources in the countries themselves or in adjacent areas . Strategic passages for oil transport such as Bab-el-Mandeb , near Somalia , or the Strait of Malacca off the Indonesian coast have become notorious targets for maritime crime . In 2013 , oil tankers shipped 15.2 million barrels of oil per day through the Strait of Malacca ; this exceeds the daily volume of oil imported into the whole of the European Union . With oil prices hovering around 70 U.S. dollars per barrel in 2018 , the hijacking of a crude oil tanker sounds like a promising deal for pirates . In 2017 , Venezuela was thrust into the limelight : Here , the templateYLabel[0] of incidents rose from five to 12 between 2016 and 2017 . It is often the crew and the pirates themselves who pay most dearly for maritime crime . In Somali waters , at least 149 crew members were held hostage in 2011 , and over 100 pirates were killed templateTitle[6] mostly by naval forces such as armed guards , who are increasingly seen to be of central importance to the protection of merchant ships .

This statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] in the templateYLabel[3] of templateYLabel[2] per liter in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] for the period between December templateTitle[7] and December templateTitle[9] . The templateYLabel[3] changes concern unleaded premium ( 95 RON ) for France , Germany , Italy , Spain , and the United Kingdom , and regular unleaded for Canada , Japan , and the United States . In December templateTitle[9] , the templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] per liter in the U.S. was eight percent higher than it was in December templateTitle[7] . templateYLabel[2] prices worldwide The templateYLabel[3] of templateYLabel[2] is a frequently discussed issue , and is a part of almost everybody 's life in developed templateTitle[6] . templateYLabel[2] prices worldwide are dependent of a number of factors : crude oil prices , costs for processing and distribution , demand , strength of currencies , taxation , and availability . The most influential factor is the crude oil templateYLabel[3] . This templateYLabel[3] includes the costs for exploration , extraction , and transport . What the consumer pays in the end is also an issue of national oil pricing policy . Typical regions with high taxes on templateYLabel[2] are European templateTitle[6] and Japan . Other templateTitle[6] keep consumer prices low by subsidizing the costs for templateYLabel[2] . Among latter templateTitle[6] are the United States , Saudi Arabia , Iran , Venezuela , Egypt , Malaysia , Bolivia , and others . There are many other factors , however , which directly influence the templateYLabel[3] of templateYLabel[2] . Wars , crises , and natural disasters in oil producing regions , for example , can obstruct the production and transportation , and thus cause higher crude oil prices . Last but not least , the end-consumer defines the templateYLabel[3] through his or her demand . A higher number of people driving cars means higher prices for templateYLabel[2] , which is often the case in the summer months or holiday seasons . The templateYLabel[2] prices in this statistic are compared based on unleaded premium templateYLabel[2] ( RON 95 ) for France , Germany , Italy , Spain and the United Kingdom , and regular unleaded templateYLabel[2] for Canada , Japan and the United States ( AKI 87 ) . RON stands for Research Octane Number , while AKI means Anti-Knock Index . Both represent the most common octane rating in the templateTitle[6] shown .

Variable weather Due to its location and the fact that it is an island , the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] experiences a diverse range of weather , sometimes in the same day . Birth excess The templateTitle[6] has a birth excess : each templateXLabel[0] the templateYLabel[0] of live births exceeds the templateYLabel[0] of templateYLabel[2] in the country . Lowest fertility rate in a ten-year period Though the templateYLabel[0] of babies born increased over time , the fertility rate reached the lowest point in a ten-year period in templateTitle[7] . This statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] in the templateYLabel[3] of automotive templateYLabel[2] per liter in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] for the period between December templateTitle[7] and December templateTitle[9] . The templateYLabel[3] changes exclude value added taxes from prices for automotive templateYLabel[2] . In December templateTitle[9] , the templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] per liter in the United States was 2.2 seven percent lower than it was in December templateTitle[9] . templateYLabel[0] in the templateYLabel[3] of automotive templateYLabel[2] There are many types of templateYLabel[2] , most commonly a fractional distillate of petroleum fuel oil , all of which are constantly being developed and adapted for the industry . As of 2006 , almost all of the petroleum-based templateYLabel[2] fuels in Europe and North America are an ultra-low sulfur templateYLabel[2] ( ULSD ) . Using ULSD will promote more strict emission technologies for templateYLabel[2] engines and lower-emission fuels . templateYLabel[2] is used for vehicles with templateYLabel[2] engines . Unlike gas engines , templateYLabel[2] engines usually inject templateYLabel[2] directly into the cylinder to continue combustion and thus , move the piston . Due to high compression ratios , templateYLabel[2] engines are often more efficient than conventional gasoline engines . However , templateYLabel[2] can convert into a gel-like substance in colder temperatures , preventing movement through the fuel systems . templateYLabel[2] has a higher volumetric energy density than conventional gasoline , which is important for fuel efficiency . During colder seasons , the templateYLabel[3] of templateYLabel[2] tends to rise as demand for heating oil also increases . From March 2015 to 2016 , many templateTitle[6] saw a decrease in the templateYLabel[3] of automotive templateYLabel[2] per liter such as the United States , United Kingdom , and Germany . In the U.S. , templateYLabel[2] cars only account for approximately three percent of the car market . In the United Kingdom , however , 42 percent of new cars registered in 2017 were templateYLabel[2] . In the European Union as a whole , some 44.8 percent of passenger cars were templateYLabel[2] as of 2017 .
templateTitle[3] 's templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] almost reached 9.9 percent in templateTitle[6] , the lowest value since 2012 . The regions with the highest templateYLabel[0] rates were situated in the South . Sicily , Calabria , and Campania registered rates above 18 percent , a large difference when compared to the Northern regions . For instance , 3.6 percent of people in Trentino-South Tyrol were unemployed , the lowest share nationwide . Young people mostly impacted Figures about the youth templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] show that the financial crisis impacted the young working population significantly . Between 2004 and 2007 , the share of unemployed individuals aged 15 to 24 years was declining . Subsequently , between templateTitle[4] and 2014 , the templateYLabel[1] increased over 15 percentage points . In this case , Southern regions had the largest proportion of young people without a job . In Sicily , Campania , and Calabria more than half of the population aged between 15 and 24 years was unemployed . Women more often unemployed In most of the Italian regions , the share of young unemployed women was higher than those of young males . In both Campania and Sicily , 60.4 percent of women aged 15 to 24 years did not have a job . The Southern region of Calabria was the place in templateTitle[3] with the highest templateYLabel[1] of unemployed young templateYLabel[0] . In this region , 50.3 percent of males were unemployed , almost ten times more than in Trentino-South Tyrol , where the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] of young templateYLabel[0] stood at about 11 percent .

In templateTitle[6] , the company brought in revenues of 29.14 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] dollars.Hewlett Packard Enterprise templateTitle[5] additional information Hewlett Packard Enterprise ( templateTitle[0] ) is an American technology company , formed on November templateTitle[4] , 2015 . It 's predecessor , Hewlett-Packard Company , started in 1935 in the garage of William Hewlett and David Packard . Initially producing a range of electronic test equipment , templateTitle[0] Co rose to become one of the leading global manufacturers of personal computers , as well as one of the largest suppliers of servers , storage and networking equipment , and a global supplier of consumer and enterprise IT services . Although templateTitle[0] did not keep the PC segment in the break-up of the old company , templateTitle[0] still has a major foothold in several global markets and templateYLabel[0] earnings for templateTitle[0] 's segments were calculated at 2.5 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in 2015 . As of early 2016 , templateTitle[0] employed around 240,000 employees globally , although the sale of its enterprise services division in May 2016 will likely affect this number Hewlett Packard Enterprise 's major segments include their enterprise group , which manufacturers technology infrastructure like servers , storage and networking equipment , and provides technology services ; their software segment , which covers big data , application services , security , and operations management ; and financial services , which allow for flexible IT consumption and investment . The organization 's size and reach leaves it holding sizeable positions in a number of global IT markets . For example , templateTitle[0] has held a market share of around five percent in the global purpose-built backup appliance market for the last few years . templateTitle[0] also supplies many of the world 's leading supercomputers , and alongside other technology giants such as IBM , SAP , and Oracle , templateTitle[0] is one of the biggest companies competing in the global big data market . Not only that , but in terms of name recognition , both templateTitle[0] and its sister company templateTitle[0] Inc will benefit from the Hewlett Packard name . As of 2015 , the Hewlett Packard brand ranked as one of the most valuable brands worldwide .

One of the biggest games on Steam While it is available on both PlayStation and Xbox One , templateTitle[0] 's origins lie in templateTitle[3] and , more specifically , on Steam . The game originally became available on Steam Early Access in late March 2017 and quickly gained a loyal legion of fans . As a result , templateTitle[0] remains one of the most successful games on the templateTitle[3] gaming platform , even though over 9,000 games were released on Steam in templateTitle[7] alone . Considering the size of each battle in templateTitle[0] , with up to 100 templateYLabel[2] pitted against each other in a fight for supremacy , it is unsurprising that the game topped the templateTitle[7] list for peak templateYLabel[0] of concurrent templateYLabel[2] on Steam . Given the nature of the game and the gaming templateTitle[6] in general , it is unsurprising that male users accounted for 57.4 percent of the gaming app 's active user accounts on the Android platform . In templateTitle[9] , an estimated 15.3 templateYLabel[2] smartwatches were sold in the United States . Between templateTitle[7] and templateTitle[9] annual templateTitle[0] templateYLabel[0] grew from just 600 thousand templateYLabel[3] to over 15 templateYLabel[2] as these devices skyrocketed in popularity . Smartwatches While digital wristwatches have been around for decades , true smartwatches are a relatively new phenomena in the consumer electronics industry . These modern devices typically include features like touchscreens , biometric monitoring , and internet connections . Consumer electronics giants Apple and Samsung are the biggest names in the industry , controlling a combined market share of over 60 percent . Estimates suggest that over 90 templateYLabel[2] of these devices will be shipped around the world in 2019 with this figure rising to over 130 templateYLabel[2] by 2023 . Wearables Smartwatches are often classified under the overarching consumer wearables market which also includes products like templateTitle[0] wristbands , templateTitle[0] clothing , and head mounted displays . The internet connections present in many of these devices allow them to share statistics and information with other templateTitle[0] devices , forming a network which is often referred to as the Internet of Things ( IoT ) .

The advantages of the countryside A survey conducted by Ifop in 2017 showed that 46 percent of French people wanted to live in a templateYLabel[3] town . Despite common beliefs , the countryside appears to have a lot to offer . In addition to a more pleasant living environment , the employment situation seems to be more advantageous in French templateYLabel[3] areas . In 2017 , the percentage of unemployed people reached 6.3 percent in templateYLabel[3] areas , compared to 10.4 percent in cities . Similarly , the percentage of labor force participants is higher in templateYLabel[3] areas .

In 2019 , the templateTitle[3] economy grew by about 3.01 percent templateYLabel[2] to the templateYLabel[4] templateXLabel[0] . templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] , also called templateYLabel[0] , is the market value of goods and services produced by a country in a certain time period . It is an important factor to evaluate the economic state of a country : the higher the templateYLabel[0] of a country , the better its economic state . Another important indicator is templateYLabel[0] per capita , which literally means `` templateYLabel[0] per person '' , but despite its name , it is not used to determine the standard of living in a country , as it does not reflect an individual 's personal income . Instead , it shows the theoretical distribution of a country 's templateYLabel[0] among its inhabitants at a certain point in time . Again , the higher the templateYLabel[0] per capita of a country , the better its economy is set . templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] is a key indicator for templateTitle[3] economy , which combines all individual economies worldwide . When looking at the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] / templateYLabel[0] of selected templateTitle[3] regions , it is obvious that templateYLabel[0] is highest in industrialized countries . A look at the distribution of templateYLabel[0] of the main industrialized and emerging countries in selected countries shows that the United States ' templateYLabel[0] is the highest by far , followed by China and Japan . The United States , China and Japan templateYLabel[2] thus the largest economies in the world , followed by Germany . This status is reflected in their templateYLabel[0] per capita ; again , the United States lead this ranking , followed by Japan and Germany . When it comes to countries with the highest increase in templateYLabel[0] in comparison to the templateYLabel[4] templateXLabel[0] , however , none of these countries templateYLabel[2] among the first few . This ranking is led by Libya , had quite a significant economic lead over the others .

The templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] is an annual templateTitle[4] prize presented by France templateTitle[4] . The templateYLabel[2] , voted for by templateTitle[4] journalists , is given to the male player who was deemed to have played the best templateTitle[4] over the previous 12 months . Unsurprisingly , two of the greatest footballers of templateTitle[4] time , Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo , top the list of all-time templateTitle[1] . Messi won the title for a record-breaking sixth time in templateTitle[9] , while Ronaldo sits just behind him in second place with five trophies to his name . Cristiano Ronaldo Portugal 's Cristiano Ronaldo won his first templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] in 2008 when he was still playing for Manchester United . He was also voted the club 's player of the year that season and helped them to templateTitle[1] three successive league titles between 2007 and 2009 . Manchester United remain the all-time leaders in templateYLabel[0] of English top flight wins , having taken home the trophy templateTitle[9] times . Ronaldo subsequently won four templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] trophies during his time at Real Madrid , where he won the Spanish league twice and the Champions League four times . Real Madrid have dominated the Champions League in recent years and took home the trophy four out of five times between 2013 and 2018 . They are by far the most successful team in European Cup history , having lifted the prestigious trophy a total of 13 times . Lionel Messi It is difficult to mention the successes of Cristiano Ronaldo without mentioning those of his rival , Lionel Messi . The Argentinian won the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] four years running between 2009 and 2012 and claimed the trophy twice more in 2015 and templateTitle[9] . Even as he enters the latter stages of his career , he remains one of the most valuable players on the planet and an integral part of both FC Barcelona and the Argentinean national team . He has won La Liga 10 times and has also been part of the winning Barcelona Champions League side four times , one short of Ronaldo 's tally .

Insulin is a hormone that acts on blood glucose levels . There templateTitle[1] several types of templateTitle[5] including type templateYLabel[0] , type II and gestational templateTitle[5] . templateTitle[5] can be treated through daily insulin injections and/or oral medication . Diagnosis and monitoring of templateTitle[5] can be done through blood glucose monitoring . However , looking at templateTitle[12] 's templateYLabel[0] compared to the other member states of the European Union , it shows that templateTitle[12] - while still having a relatively high templateYLabel[0] - is not at the top of the list of countries with a high public templateYLabel[0] . Yet , templateTitle[12] has a history of spending significantly more than it has been acquiring in templateYLabel[2] revenue . This unbalanced spending vs revenue situation is expected to change at some point between 2015 and 2016 . When spending more than it received , templateTitle[12] covered its yearly deficits by borrowing money to make up the difference . The accumulation of these deficits resulted in templateTitle[12] 's growing debt , which in 2014 amounted to a total of 317.31 billion euros , and with the economic crisis , the country has had difficulties in paying back its large debts . However , it appears as if templateTitle[12] is beginning to keep templateYLabel[2] spending below revenue in the near future . In order to recover , the country also needs economic growth , and according to the IMF , templateYLabel[5] is expected to increase after 2015 and along with it , templateTitle[12] will likely see positive growth rates .

The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] shows the share of unemployed people among potential employees available for the job market . This figure is calculated as follows templateTitle[7] number of unemployed persons : number of unemployed persons + number of employed persons = templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] ( in percent ) .The status of being unemployed is defined as when an employed person is laid off , fired or quits his work and is still looking for a job . Even in a healthy economy templateYLabel[0] occurs . If former employed persons go back to school or leave the job to take care of children they are not defined as unemployed . templateYLabel[0] can be a result of advanced technology , when machines replace worker tasks . Sometimes templateYLabel[0] is caused by job outsourcing , when a company gets insolvent . Large-scale templateYLabel[0] is also caused when consumer demands gets down and companies loose profit.Unemployment benefit payments in templateTitle[5] are only paid , if you are unemployed and worked for the last 12 months . Otherwise benefits are received in the form of Arbeitslosengeld II , also called Hartz IV , which distributes social payments to people without an income who can not work to make a living .

The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] rose to 1.55 percent in templateTitle[10] after an unprecedented time below 0.2 percent after the Financial Crisis . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] is the interest templateYLabel[2] from the templateYLabel[0] Reserve , the central bank in the templateTitle[6] templateTitle[7] . It is a very important financial indicator and analysts all over the world watch this templateYLabel[2] . What is a central bank templateYLabel[2] ? The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] is the templateYLabel[2] at which financial institutions can borrow overnight from other depository institutions . These overnight loans are vital for banks because they ensure that the bank has constant access to cash , guaranteeing liquidity in the financial system . However , a higher templateYLabel[2] means banks prefer to hold their money , slowing the loans issued and causes a decrease in the money supply . While this slows the economy , it also reduces inflation . Historic perspective The history of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] shows ups and downs that follow the business cycle . When there is a recession , the templateYLabel[2] drops , slowly increasing after the economy recovers . In addition to aggressive asset purchase programs , some central banks , including the European Central Bank , introduced negative interest rates . It remains to be seen how the templateYLabel[0] Reserve and other central banks will react to the next crisis .

Crowdfunding failure Putting yourself , your ideas and your templateYLabel[2] out into the world and subjecting them to the possibility of public scrutiny is not the easiest pill to swallow for a lot of people , and failure can be hard to accept . The over hundred thousand of templateTitle[4] templateXLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] on US crowdfunding platform templateTitle[0] are no exception to the crowdfunding industry . Many crowdfunders fail to get the backing they require from investors but that is n't to say that there are n't a lot of templateTitle[4] templateXLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] emerging from the crowdfunding arena . The concept of crowdfunding is growing all over the world , as is the growth in the templateYLabel[0] of platforms on which entrepreneurs can get their ideas templateXLabel[1] . When embarking upon a crowdfunding campaign , it is important to have a solid plan in place . As failure of a campaign by not reaching the financial goal can go some way to changing the public perception of the templateYLabel[2] , business and online-reputation of the company before it even has a chance to get off the ground . However , with the economic climate the way it is , crowdfunding has been widely praised as a good alternative to the conventional methods such as lending from banks or finding accredited investments .

The Syrian refugee crisis The war in templateTitle[3] has been escalating since 2011 , which has made it difficult to estimate the current templateTitle[1] of the country . The templateTitle[1] of the country was last determined to be over 21 templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[4] . Previously , templateTitle[1] growth rates had been relatively high , but since the war , templateTitle[3] has been experiencing the opposite , and now claims the highest rate of templateTitle[1] decline in the world . Large numbers of Syrians have been fleeing the county and others have lost their lives due to the conflict within the country 's borders . As of October 2015 , the templateTitle[0] number of casualties had risen to over 250,000 - including around 116,000 civilians and about 13,000 children . This has caused more than 4 templateYLabel[2] people to flee the country , making it the worst refugee crisis of our generation . Still , templateYLabel[2] more have also been internally displaced and the sheer scale of the crisis is evident . Neighboring counties have received large numbers of Syrian refugees , but the crisis is now being felt across Europe as thousands of refugees are risking their lives everyday migrating to Europe in search of a brighter future . European cooperation is needed and not all countries are meeting Europe 's migrant quota .

At the end of the 2015 fiscal templateXLabel[0] , the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] had 55,555 templateYLabel[2] worldwide.AdidasAdidas AG is the largest sportswear manufacturer in Europe and the second largest in the templateTitle[7] . The templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] 's global net sales amounted to about 21.22 billion euros in 2017 . In 2014 , the North American region of the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] generated 19 percent of the company 's retail net sales.The templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] owns several sporting brands , including Reebok and Taylor Made . Reebok is seen as a cheaper and less of a premium brand . This allows templateTitle[5] to release any significant breakthroughs in research and development through the Reebok brand slightly behind the release through templateTitle[5] . As a result , they are able to do this cheaper than a lot of the competition.As well as sponsoring individual sports personalities like David Beckham and Damian Lillard , templateTitle[5] also sponsors major organizations such as FIFA and UEFA competitions , the NBA and the Olympics . By making these actions , templateTitle[5] increases their product awareness globally and raises its customer base ; maintaining its appeal as one of the most valuable sports business brands in the templateTitle[7] .

With total assets estimated at approximately 76 billion U.S. dollars , Arnault was the world 's fourth richest man and the richest man in Europe according to Forbes in 2019 . He also participated transform the LMVH – a French luxury goods conglomerate formed templateTitle[2] the fusion of Moët Hennessy and the French fashion house Louis Vuitton , into a major patron of arts in France . As LMVH 's CEO , Arnault is reportedly one of the seven wealthiest art collectors in France as of 2017 . His private collection , often exposed together with pieces owned templateTitle[2] the LMVH , includes pieces of art made templateTitle[2] iconic painters such as Picasso and Andy Warhol . Although the number of Australians is rising slowly and continuously , year-on-year templateTitle[1] growth in templateTitle[3] has only recently recovered from a slight slump in 2010 and 2011 , while the fertility rate has been stable over the last decade . Life expectancy of templateTitle[3] 's templateTitle[1] is quite high in international comparison , for example , templateTitle[3] is also among the leading countries when it comes to this key factor . For templateTitle[5] , an increase by almost templateTitle[5] templateYLabel[2] employed people is expected . Willing but unable The American unemployment rate has seen its ups and downs over the last decades ; recovery from an alarming increase in unemployment during the financial crisis in 2009 and the Great Recession fueled by job loss and bankruptcies could only recently be declared , after the Obama administration focused on job creation from 2010 on . Since then , unemployment has been on a downward trend while templateYLabel[0] figures are steadily increasing . The Great Inherited Recession The financial crisis happened under President Bush , when the housing market bubble in the templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] burst and caused a global banking crisis . templateYLabel[2] of Americans lost their homes and their jobs and thus their source of income . Since the economy usually takes a few years to react to and recover from such a crisis , the templateTitle[3] templateTitle[4] suffered the consequences for several years . Key economic indicators , like the unemployment rate or the inflation rate , did not recover fully until 2016 , meaning that remnants of the crisis were inherited by the next sitting U.S. President , Barack Obama . In the same vein , current U.S. President , Donald Trump , now benefits from the Obama job creation initiative , since unemployment today is historically low .

Vehicle templateYLabel[3] in EuropeTerrorist templateYLabel[3] using a vehicle to deliberately drive though a crowd has been used increasingly by terrorists in the mid to late 2010s . This tactic was used in the 2016 Nice truck templateYLabel[3] , which targeted people celebrating Bastille Day and resulted in the deaths of 86 people . The type of templateYLabel[3] occurred at the Berlin Christmas Markets on December 19 that year , which saw 12 people lose their lives and 56 others injured . Global terrorism spike after 2013 Between 2007 and 2012 the templateYLabel[0] of deaths caused by terrorism worldwide declined from over 22.7 thousand to just under 11.1 thousand . From 2013 onwards however templateYLabel[2] fatalities rose , reaching over 32.7 thousand in 2014 . Although templateYLabel[2] fatalities declined after 2014 , they have not yet descended to pre 2013 levels .

The statistic shows templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in the United States between templateTitle[6] and templateTitle[8] . Here , the templateYLabel[1] of templateYLabel[0] derived from templateTitle[1] fuels came to approximately 81.2 templateYLabel[3] British thermal units in templateTitle[8] . templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] energies – additional informationFossil fuels are hydrocarbon-containing natural resources formed from the remains of dead plants or animals that have been subject to immense pressure from a buildup of layers over millions of years . There are three major forms of templateTitle[1] fuels templateTitle[5] coal , oil , and natural gas which were considered the world 's primary templateYLabel[0] source since the Industrial Revolution in the 18th century . The templateYLabel[0] demand in the United States is largely covered by templateTitle[1] fuels . In 2017 , the templateTitle[0] generated approximately 4.02 trillion kilowatt hours of electricity . About 82 % of the electricity generated was from templateTitle[1] fuels and nuclear resources . Petroleum is one of the county 's main templateYLabel[0] sources with more than 36 templateYLabel[3] British thermal units consumed in 2017 . The liquid is predominantly used in the transportation sector . Despite its prominent use over the last few centuries , templateTitle[1] fuels are finite resources and burning these fuels can harm the environment . Under the threat of climate change , the pollution caused by templateTitle[1] fuels has put the industry under scrutiny . Burning any templateTitle[1] fuels produces carbon dioxide , a greenhouse gas which contributes to global warming . The volume of global energy-related carbon dioxide emissions has steadily risen over the last few decades , from 15.54 gigatons in 1975 to 33.14 gigatons in templateTitle[8] . There are several alternative resources that can supply clean templateYLabel[0] , including water , biomass , wind , geothermal and solar templateYLabel[0] . These renewable templateYLabel[0] sources are slowly becoming more efficient and are argued to be competitive with templateTitle[1] fuels as a means to cover global templateYLabel[0] needs .

This economic powerhouse has managed to maintain control of its inflation rate , keeping it below three percent since at least 2004 . Despite the worldwide recession in 2008 and 2009 and a dip in the growth rate of the templateYLabel[0] , templateTitle[7] managed to maintain positive growth in the templateYLabel[0] itself . templateTitle[7] is disadvantaged , however , when it comes to natural resources . A large amount of the landmass of templateTitle[7] is human-occupied , leaving little in terms of husbandry or agriculture . It has become a highly urbanized country and employs very little of its workforce in agriculture , choosing instead to focus on its services sector . The population of templateTitle[7] is aging , providing a rocky economic forecast for years ahead . As the baby boomer generation starts to retire , they will leave more job openings than there will be workers to fill them . The government will have to work to provide retirement pensions for a growing amount of people , although if current trends persevere , there will be fewer people left paying taxes to fund the pensions .

The templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] The templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] is a somewhat broad concept , including all organized events to present or display a selection of some type of item . At one end of the spectrum this includes public exhibitions of art or history in a gallery or museum , while at the other end templateYLabel[0] trade fairs , where goods and services associated with a specific templateTitle[6] templateYLabel[0] exhibited to invited guests only . Despite the variations both sides of the templateTitle[6] templateYLabel[0] business-focused – the templateTitle[0] popular art exhibitions can attract upwards of a million visitors , while the trade fair templateTitle[6] generated global revenues of over 30 billion U.S. dollars in 2016 . Trade fairs In many respects , the challenges templateTitle[3] the trade show templateTitle[6] templateYLabel[0] more complex than that templateTitle[3] the art and history exhibitions , given the restricted supply of items to be exhibited for the latter . Technological developments such as digital advertising social media may reduce the need for physical shows to create product awareness – although the two templateYLabel[0] not mutually exclusive , as the internet can also be used to promote exhibitions . The face-to-face nature of trade shows also provides a unique opportunity for networking . Interestingly , while the trade fair templateTitle[6] is largest in the United States , the largest trade fair organizers tend to be European companies .

Due to the conditions needed by the fruit that make it , templateTitle[2] requires special climate conditions : templateTitle[2] cultivating areas have to meet requirements and provide a moderate climate , the right amount of sunshine hours and fertile soils . Traditionally , the cultivation of Champagne , an exclusive sparkling templateTitle[2] , is limited to the Champagne region of France . However , some countries use the term also for general sparkling wines not originating from that region . The latest templateTitle[2] production figures listed Italy , France and Spain as the leading templateTitle[2] producing countries worldwide . The United States was ranked fourth , where templateTitle[2] production is primarily concentrated in California .

The templateTitle[5] Korean K-pop boyband templateTitle[0] , also known as the Bangtan Boys templateYLabel[2] around 2.7 million templateYLabel[6] of their templateYLabel[3] up until templateTitle[9] . The boyband is known as the biggest boyband in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] and has fans all over the globe . The templateTitle[0] phenomenon templateTitle[0] , also known as ‘ Bangtan Boys ' ( or Bangtan Sonyeondan in Korean ) , formed in 2010 and had their debut in templateTitle[7] . Quickly after their debut , the seven-member K-Pop boyband became one of the biggest bands in the country , which ultimately led to international success . The group went on seven world tours , released three concert movies in cinemas all over the world , and broke several records on a national and international basis . Their fanbase , known as `` A.R.M.Y . `` , is known for being one of the most active fan clubs on social media . Because of their international success , templateTitle[0] has been awarded the Order of Cultural Merit by president Moon Jae-In . K-pop idol culture K-pop , short for templateTitle[5] Korean popular music , is a genre of pop music originating in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] . While the term describes songs of a variety of music styles , it developed an `` idol culture '' that proved to be successful both in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] and around the globe . K-pop idols are famous for being good-looking , fashionable , and highly trained in both singing and dancing . Music videos are often colorful and feature powerful dance choreographies . Individuals that are hoping to become a K-pop idol sign with agencies , preferably one of the leading companies , and dedicate years into their training before they might be able to debut in a boy- or a girl group . Due to high standards in the industry , K-pop labels are known to enforce strict rules on both trainees as well as idols .

This statistic shows the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] of templateTitle[3] from 2014 to 2018 , with a forecast through templateTitle[4] . In 2019 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] of templateTitle[3] was estimated at almost 210 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[0] . templateTitle[1] of templateTitle[3] templateTitle[3] has a surprisingly low ( and decreasing ) templateTitle[1] growth rate ; despite it being home to the largest number of Catholics in the world , the majority of women in templateTitle[3] use some form of contraception , which is often government-subsidized or free , even though the Catholic Church retains its stance that the use of contraceptives is inherently wrong . Within the space of just one generation , families have gone from having more than six children to having just one or two , and the share of Catholics in the templateTitle[1] is dwindling , too . The influence of 'telenovelas ' — the overwhelmingly popular soap operas often with strong women figures and fewer than three children — could also be helping shape the templateTitle[1] 's view of what an ideal family is . The fertility rate in templateTitle[3] fell below the replacement rate in 2006 and is still decreasing . The impending templateTitle[1] imbalance in templateTitle[3] can be seen in the decreasing lower tier of the country 's age distribution . This follows a trend similar to the one Japan and many European countries are experiencing , which are now facing the problems of providing for an aging templateTitle[1] with fewer young and working taxpayers . The trend is not quite as extreme in templateTitle[3] , giving it time to prepare for the fallout of decreasing family size . This preparation will be important to help the country maintain its emerging economic strength , which is watched with interest by many economists who have said that templateTitle[3] 's is one to watch — thus its position as one of the pillars of the `` big four '' BRIC countries .

The majority of the Mexican templateTitle[1] is Roman Catholic , owing to its colonial Spanish background . Spanish is the predominant language , with several regional and local dialects spoken , but a number of indigenous languages , such as Nahuatl , survive and are also spoken around templateTitle[3] . One worrying and relatively recent trend in templateTitle[3] is the growing share of the templateTitle[1] becoming overweight or obese . It is not entirely clear what sort of effect the obesity epidemic is going to have on Mexican templateTitle[1] numbers in the long run , but is starting to manifest itself not just in physical appearance , but in the increased rates of heart disease , hypertension , and diabetes . In fact , diabetes was one of the top causes of deaths for Mexicans in recent years .

What is the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] ? The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] , or templateYLabel[0] index , is a statistical measure of economic inequality and wealth templateTitle[3] among a population . A value of zero represents perfect economic equality , and a value of one represents perfect economic inequality . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] helps to visualize templateTitle[2] inequality in a more digestible way . For example , according to the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] , the District of Columbia has the greatest amount of templateTitle[2] inequality in the templateTitle[0] with a score of 0.53 , and Alaska has the greatest templateTitle[2] equality with a score of 0.42 . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] around the world The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is also an effective measure to help picture templateTitle[2] inequality around the world . For example , in 2017 templateTitle[2] inequality was highest in South Africa , while templateTitle[2] inequality was lowest in Azerbaijan .

For comparison , templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[0] in China had reached about 6,995.25 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in 2013 . templateTitle[9] 's economic progress templateTitle[9] 's progress as a country over the past decade can be attributed to a global dependency on cheaper production of goods and services from developed countries around the world . templateTitle[9] 's economy is built upon its agriculture , manufacturing and services sector , which , along with its drastic rise in population and demand for employment , led to a significant increase of the nation 's templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] . Despite experiencing rather momentous economic gains since the mid 2000s , the Indian economy stagnated around 2012 , with a decrease in general growth as well as the value of its currency . Residents and consumers in templateTitle[9] have recently shown pessimism regarding the future of the Indian economy as well as their own financial situation , and with the recent economic standstill , consumer confidence in the country could potentially lower in the near future . Typical Indian exports consist of agricultural products , jewelry , chemicals and ores . Imports consist primarily of crude oil , gold and precious stones , used primarily in the manufacturing of jewelry . As a result , templateTitle[9] has seen a rather highly increased demand of several gems in order to boost their jewelry industry and in general their exports . Although templateTitle[9] does not export an extensive amount of goods , especially when considering the stature of the country , templateTitle[9] has remained as one of the world 's largest exporters .

In templateTitle[3] , 54 percent of templateTitle[2] 's templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[3] lived in templateYLabel[2] areas and cities . The shrinking templateYLabel[3] of templateTitle[2] About half of templateTitle[2] 's templateYLabel[3] lives in templateYLabel[2] areas , with the largest city and capital Bucharest only having about 1.9 million inhabitants - not very much considering that templateTitle[2] reported a templateYLabel[3] of about templateTitle[3] million people in 2015 . Bucharest is also significantly larger than any of the other small cities around the country , which only have close to or less than 300,000 inhabitants each . The fact that templateTitle[2] has not urbanized to the same level of most developed countries is an indicator that the country is still developing . As templateTitle[2] progresses , it has an important advantage over other developing nations : It is a member of the European Union , and thus has access to the European market . However , unlike other developing countries , the Romanian templateYLabel[3] is decreasing and expected to shrink by more than half a million by 2020 . This is caused by a low fertility rate , which is less than the replacement rate , by emigration and by an aging templateYLabel[3] . The median age of the Romanian templateYLabel[3] is expected to increase to as high as 44 years in 2020 . A contributing factor to this may be the fact that while the older generation stays in templateTitle[2] , the younger people migrate to other countries within the European Union which have stronger economies and more employment opportunities than templateTitle[2] .

The problem of templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] Simply put , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] is the templateTitle[0] of a country divided templateTitle[6] the area of the country . While this can be an interesting measure of how many people live in a country and how large the country is , it does not account for the degree of urbanization , or the share of people who live in urban centers . For example , Russia is the largest country in the world and has a comparatively low templateTitle[0] , so its templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] is very low . However , much of the country is uninhabited , so cities in Russia templateYLabel[4] much more densely populated than the rest of the country . Urbanization in the United States While the United States is not very densely populated compared to other countries , its templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] has increased significantly over the past few decades . The degree of urbanization has also increased , and well over half of the templateTitle[0] lives in urban centers .

The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] in the United States from templateTitle[4] to 2019 , and a forecast thereof for 2020 and templateTitle[6] . In 2019 , around 5.34 templateYLabel[5] of templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[2] were templateYLabel[3] in the United States . templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[2] templateTitle[3] in the United States The steady rise in templateTitle[3] after the sharp drop in 2008 is indicative of the general consensus that the housing market is recovering . Construction is starting to show positive signs , consumers are growing in confidence and are becoming freer with their spending and the market is entering new periods of growth . This is a far cry from the dire situation in the not too distant past , in the run up to the bursting of the templateTitle[0] housing bubble . Interest rates were very low at that time , making credit cheap and abundantly available . Banks and lending institutions led people to believe that it was okay to buy multiple properties with little money and that real estate was just about the safest investment anyone could make . More and more people decided to take the risk and invest in the market . This coupled with the increased templateYLabel[0] of people descending on the market caused prices to soar ; it seemed like an easy way to make cash fast . But this is how the bubble formed and it was this bubble , upon bursting , that would set into motion a chain of events that would bring the global economy to templateYLabel[6] knees ; plunging the world into an economic depression of which it has not seen the likes since the Great Depression of the 1930s .

Smartphone ownership As of 2018 , 95 percent of people aged 16 to 34 years owned a smartphone . While it is to be expected that ownership rates decline with age , the templateYLabel[0] of people over the age of 55 who own a smartphone is growing . 42 percent of people in this age bracket owned a smartphone in 2016 , whereas that rate climbed to more than 50 percent for the first time in 2018 . Globally , it is expected that 40 percent of the population will own a smartphone templateTitle[10] 2021 . Total templateYLabel[0] of the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] staggered in 2012 and even moreso in 2015 . Recent events are also bound to reduce consumer confidence and drag down growth . The templateXLabel[0] began with the economic slowdown in China and has continued on with the United Kingdom 's decision to leave the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] . The long term effects this decision is expected to have have an overall negative effect on templateYLabel[0] growth within the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] . However , the effects will likely hit the UK and Ireland more so . By 2030 , it is expected that the templateYLabel[0] growth of the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] will be negative at around minus 0.36 percent . Even considering an optimistic scenario , templateYLabel[0] of the UK is expected to decrease by 2.72 percent by 2030 , as well - a pessimistic forecast even reducing templateYLabel[0] growth to a 7.7 percent decrease . Yet , it is still too early to tell how Brexit will play out in reality , but it will almost certainly impact current future projections of templateYLabel[0] growth in the templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] and the templateTitle[5] Area .

Moreover , among the total French audience , Netflix 's coverage increased from 7,7 percent in October templateTitle[8] to 14,3 percent in May 2018 . Nevertheless , the United Kingdom remains the leading Netflix market in Europe based on subscription numbers : almost templateTitle[8] templateYLabel[2] people in the country subscribed to Netflix as of December templateTitle[8] . In 2018 , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in templateTitle[3] was at around 5.83 percent . templateTitle[3] 's economy Three-quarter of templateTitle[3] 's workforce is employed in the services sector , with the other two sectors , agriculture and industry , accounting for the rest of templateTitle[3] 's templateYLabel[0] . The country 's main export and import partner is the United States . Although both export and import figures have increased over the last few years , the trade balance of goods in templateTitle[3] – i.e . the value of templateTitle[3] 's exports minus the value of its imports – has slumped dramatically since the economic crisis hit in 2008 . In 2009 , for the first time in a decade , templateTitle[3] reported a trade deficit , and the figures are still struggling to recover . Additionally , templateTitle[3] 's public debt has been increasing since the crisis . Although a few key figures are still not back to the usual level , templateTitle[3] and its economy seem to have more or less bounced back from the crisis ; as can be seen above , the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is gradually decreasing , for example , and gross domestic product / GDP in templateTitle[3] has been increasing steadily . templateTitle[3] is thus among the countries with the largest proportion of global gross domestic product / GDP based on Purchasing Power Parity . templateTitle[3] is among the leading trading nations worldwide , and an important part of its economy is the export of oil . The country hosts significant oil resources , in fact , its capacity is the third-largest after those of Saudi Arabia and Venezuela .

Eighteen to twenty-nine-year-olds were the largest templateTitle[9] of current templateTitle[4] smokers in the United States in templateTitle[5] . Roughly a quarter of the templateTitle[8] templateTitle[9] were current smokers , with usage dipping among older templateTitle[8] groups . Seniors were the least likely , with only three percent stating that they were current smokers . Support for legalization Although cannabis is still federally illegal , it has been legalized for recreational consumption in 10 states since 2012 . Nationwide support for the federal legalization of cannabis has grown every templateXLabel[0] , with 18 to 34-year-olds being the biggest supporters . Seventy-eight-percent of Americans in that templateTitle[8] templateTitle[9] supported templateTitle[4] legalization in 2018 , nearly double the level of support in 2003 . Approval of legalization is more than 50 percent among all templateTitle[8] groups . Approval for medical templateTitle[3] Support for the medical usage of cannabis is even higher , and unlike recreational usage , approval levels templateYLabel[0] very close among all templateTitle[8] groups . The average degree of support among all templateTitle[8] groups was seventy-four percent . In contrast to the young templateTitle[8] of most recreational smokers , in Oregon , one of the first state to legalize recreational cannabis , the highest templateYLabel[0] of people registered as medical templateTitle[4] patients were 55 to 69 years old .

Reduction of the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] and recovery of the economy in the UK The templateYLabel[1] of the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] , which amounted to around 1,600 templateYLabel[3] pounds in 2014 - more than it has ever been - is projected to keep rising . Since the economic recession of 2007 - 08 , economic growth in the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] has been slow , but it has been able to recover . In 2014 , the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] recorded a 2.8 percent growth rate . Many believe that if the economy is stable , the government will reduce spending and not accrue any more templateYLabel[1] , and it can indeed be seen that while government spending continues to increase , the gap between spending and revenue is projected to get smaller . If the government were to earn more than it spends , it could use the money left over to pay the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] and start to reduce it . However , what is even more important is the size of the templateYLabel[1] in relation to the size of the country 's economy ; if the templateYLabel[1] grows slower than the economy , the templateYLabel[1] to GDP ratio can still fall , despite a budget deficit . The ratio of government expenditure to GDP indicates that the economy is recovering at a faster rate than government expenditure , with the ratio decreasing significantly over the last decade and the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in relation to GDP being expected to decrease further as well - albeit slowly . This should help relieve concerns over the templateTitle[4] templateTitle[5] 's mounting templateYLabel[1] , but for some templateYLabel[1] reduction is just not fast enough .

The development of the world templateTitle[3] from 1950 to 2030 is estimated to be tripled according to United Nations ' data.The majority of the world templateTitle[3] lives in Asia , but the templateTitle[3] in Africa is forecasted to rise from 1,031 in year 2010 up to 4,185 in year 2100 . This forecast is based on the rapid templateYLabel[3] of the developing countries , such as Africa . Developing countries are well known for its urban residents living in slum conditions . A slum is defined as a thickly populated , metropolitan area with bad living conditions and people living below the poverty line.The urban templateTitle[3] in developing countries , who lived in slums has increased steadily for the last decades . In 1990 , around 656.7 million people were living in slums in developing countries , while this number rose to 827.7 million people living in slums of developing countries in 2010.The number of people living in slums worldwide is estimated to templateYLabel[3] from 1,145,984 in year 2010 to 1,477,291 in year 2020 templateTitle[5] the UN-HABITAT . In some countries the templateTitle[3] living in slums grows faster than in others , naturally . The percentage of urban slum dwellers in Morocco for example nearly doubled from 13 percent to 24 percent between 2000 and 2010 , while the same templateYLabel[1] in Turkey only grew moderately from 13 to 18 percent .
The total templateTitle[0] expenditure in templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] in templateTitle[11] accounted for approximately 8.1 templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[8] 's Gross Domestic Product ( templateYLabel[2] ) that templateXLabel[0] . This was the result of the steepest increase in the past ten years and was the first time templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] as a share of the templateYLabel[2] exceeded eight templateYLabel[0] . This share saw a continuous increase over the past decade , indicating that as the templateYLabel[2] grew , templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] grew at an even faster rate . templateTitle[8] 's templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[0] capita was over 33 thousand U.S. dollars in templateTitle[11] , increased from around 18.2 thousand dollars in 2009 , while overall medical expenses in templateTitle[11] had increased by almost ten templateYLabel[0] over the previous templateXLabel[0] , up to around 14.44 billion templateTitle[7] Korean won ( over 12 million U.S. dollars ) . Nearly 60 templateYLabel[0] of the costs were covered by the government or the public templateTitle[0] insurance system . Higher templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] is still insufficient Even though templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] as a share of the templateYLabel[2] exceeded eight templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[11] , this was lower than the OECD average of 8.8 templateYLabel[0] . Likewise , the government 's templateTitle[0] expenses were around 60 templateYLabel[0] and slightly increased from the previous templateXLabel[0] , but still lower than the OECD average of almost 74 templateYLabel[0] . The increased expenditure was largely attributed to the introduction of what is dubbed `` Moon Jae-In Care '' , named after the current Korean president , much like the American Affordable Care Act is colloquially known as `` Obamacare '' . In short , the government will provide greatly expanded coverage for medical treatments and care , increasing the reimbursement rate of the public templateTitle[0] insurance , along with other measures . In addition , the Korean population as a whole is rapidly aging , and more people than before are being hospitalized and receiving examinations . Koreans already see doctors far more frequently than any other OECD nationals . Strains on templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] and insurance The Korean national public templateTitle[0] insurance system enjoyed seven years of surplus revenue since 2011 but fell into the red in templateTitle[11] . As noted above , Moon Jae-In Care and the aging population are largely responsible . The years ' worth of revenue is projected to run templateTitle[7] in the coming years . Foreigners who come to templateTitle[8] as medical tourists make things worse , with an all-time high of over 380 thousand medical tourists to templateTitle[8] in templateTitle[11] .

Traditional templateTitle[5] sales are suffering due to the growing popularity of the computer templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] ; however , this is somewhat balanced by a constant demand templateYLabel[1] infants ' templateTitle[5] . templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] are not necessities but rather viewed as a treat of which frequency and cost is dependent on the affluence of the buyer . Grandparents of the baby-boomer generations are generally wealthier than in previous generations , especially in developed nations , and are able to spoil their grandchildren to a greater extent . The popularity of many templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] is short-lived and/or seasonal , which means the retail templateTitle[8] is subject to rapid change . It is becoming increasingly challenging templateYLabel[1] independent templateTitle[5] stores to compete with mass merchandisers and department stores , as these types of stores are able to exploit economies of scale to offer low prices . However , the biggest threat and the most significant substitutes to the templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] are computer templateTitle[7] . Children are playing computer templateTitle[7] at a lower age in an increasingly digital world . Consoles , PCs and mobile phones are playing an ever growing part in children 's lives by providing templateTitle[7] , education and entertainment . Despite not providing a cheaper alternative on the whole , computer templateTitle[7] are becoming more popular to the detriment of traditional templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] where customer loyalty is low with no switching costs . The templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] templateTitle[8] is generally fragmented , with numerous retailers present , boosting the competition within this templateTitle[8] . Some templateTitle[8] players are highly dependent on revenues from templateTitle[5] and templateTitle[7] sales , with department stores and supermarkets being less dependent than specialized templateTitle[5] stores , due to the variety of goods on offer .

The templateYLabel[3] of templateTitle[2] templateTitle[2] is currently 94 percent templateYLabel[2] , making it the eighth most templateYLabel[2] country in the world . However , even though the majority of the templateYLabel[3] lives in templateYLabel[2] areas , the island itself is not densely populated . The templateYLabel[3] overwhelmingly lives in the nation 's capital and largest city , Reykjavik , which is located in the southwest corner of the island and is considered the northernmost national capital in the world . Reykjavik is only home to around 120,000 people and has more of a suburban feel to it than that of an templateYLabel[2] metropolis . Reykjavik has become the home base for the country 's booming tourist industry for those who want to venture out to explore the island 's vast wilderness . In 2014 alone , there were around 4.4 million tourists who stopped on the island for a short stay ( 413264 ) . The two second largest cities , Kopavogur and Hafnarfjour , templateYLabel[0] also located very close to the capital , and templateYLabel[0] each home to around 30,000 people- significantly less than the templateYLabel[3] of Reykjavik . The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateTitle[4] in templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] from templateTitle[5] to 2018 , with forecasts from 2019 to templateTitle[7] . In 2018 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] had a value of about 71.06 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] . This figure is expected to rise to 83.1 templateYLabel[4] by templateTitle[7] . The templateYLabel[1] is composed of the segments gate revenues , media rights , sponsorships and merchandising . templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in the United States templateTitle[6] additional information Today 's templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateTitle[4] is experiencing strong growth , having developed into a full-blown worldwide industry in the past decades , with unprecedented levels of templateYLabel[2] and more industry players than ever . The templateYLabel[1] is divided into four main segments : gate receipts ( ticket sales for live sporting events ) , sponsorship , media rights and merchandising . With more than 71 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] in templateYLabel[2] in 2018 , the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is one of the largest in the world . On the global level and in the templateYLabel[5] as well , gate receipts represent one of the largest templateYLabel[2] segments in the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] . For 2018 , some 19.2 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] in templateYLabel[2] were generated through ticket sales alone in templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] . The largest templateYLabel[2] stream in the US templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is the media rights templateYLabel[1] , where templateYLabel[2] is generated from fees paid by radio , television or internet broadcasters to distribute sporting events . Due to the wide availability of media devices , this sector has increased tremendously in templateTitle[4] in the past ten years , from 8.5 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] in templateYLabel[2] in 2006 to 20.14 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] in 2018 . The sponsorship sector , which includes revenues generated by payments from companies to have their products associated with an event , a team or a league , has also been expanding in the past years . In 2018 , an estimated 17.17 templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] templateYLabel[6] of revenues were generated through this channel , with projections as high as 20.65 templateYLabel[4] by templateTitle[7] . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket . This product basket contains products and services , on which the average consumer spends money throughout the templateXLabel[0] . They include expenses for groceries , clothes , rent , power , telecommunications , recreational activities and raw materials ( e.g . gas , oil ) , as well as federal fees and taxes . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is the templateYLabel[1] at which the general rise in the level of prices , goods and services in an economy occurs and how it affects the cost of living of those living in a particular country . It influences the interest rates paid on savings and mortgage rates but also has a bearing on levels of state pensions and benefits received . Although most countries refused to ratify this latter treaty , there has been a worldwide commitment towards so called `` green energy . In 2018 , templateTitle[9] 's real templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] was around 1.88 percent templateYLabel[2] to the templateYLabel[4] year.Economy of templateTitle[9] As an indicator for the shape of a country 's economy , there templateYLabel[2] not many factors as telling as templateYLabel[0] . templateYLabel[0] is the total market value of all final goods and services that have been produced within a country within a given period of time , usually a templateXLabel[0] . Real templateYLabel[0] figures serve as an even more reliable tool in determining the direction in which a country 's economy may be swaying , as they templateYLabel[2] adjusted for inflation and reflect real price changes . templateTitle[9] is one of the largest economies in the world and is counted among the globe 's wealthiest nations . It has a relatively small labor force in comparison to some of the world 's other largest economic powers , amounting to just under 19 million . Unemployment in templateTitle[9] has remained relatively high as the country has battled against the tide of economic woe that swept across the majority of the world after the 2008 financial meltdown , and although moving in the right direction , there is still some way to go for templateTitle[9] . templateTitle[9] is among the leading trading nations worldwide , owing to the absolutely vast supplies of natural resources , which make up a key part of the Canadian trading relationship with the United States , the country with which templateTitle[9] trades by far the most . In recent years , around three quarters of Canadian exports went to the United States and just over half of its imports came from its neighbor to the south . The relationship is very much mutually beneficial ; templateTitle[9] is the leading foreign energy supplier to the United States .

Household consumption affects the templateYLabel[0] There are many factors affecting the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] of a country , and the household consumption is one important factor . The household consumption is regulated by the level of employment in the country , and the economics of the households . During the period from 2011 to 2017 , both the level of employment and the annual household disposable income increased , which in turn generated a higher household consumption . Chancroids are a sexually transmitted infection ( STI ) caused by a bacterium and classified by genital ulcers . Sexually Transmitted Infections in the U.S . Recent data suggests that there are as few as 3 templateYLabel[0] of chancroids in the U.S. annually . The number of templateTitle[4] templateYLabel[0] has also been declining globally . Other STIs , such as syphilis have similarly been decreasing in the U.S. in modern history . However there are other STIs that are more common in the U.S. For example , the templateTitle[0] of chlamydia templateYLabel[0] has increased dramatically in recent years.STI Prevention Some STIs are preventable through vaccination and condoms . A survey from templateTitle[11] indicated that just over half of U.S. female teenagers were up to date on their human papillomavirus vaccinations . Condoms , while known for their effectiveness in preventing sexually transmitted infections , are not used as frequently as public health officials would like . When U.S. male adults were asked about their usage of condoms in their last sexual encounter , less than half indicated that they had used a male condom .

A templateYLabel[5] is a mobile templateYLabel[5] that uses an identifiable open Operating System ( OS ) and has more advanced computing capability and connectivity than a basic templateYLabel[5] . The OS is supported by third party applications ( commonly known as apps ) written by the developer community . The operating system must be able to support a multitasking environment and user interface that can handle multiple applications at the same time . Two of the most popular operating systems on the market templateYLabel[0] made by Google ( Android ) and Apple ( iOS ) who had a combined stake of over 90 percent of the templateYLabel[5] market templateYLabel[0] worldwide at the end of 2016 . The popularity of the templateYLabel[5] has risen immensely since Apple introduced its first iPhone in 2007 , templateYLabel[3] 43.5 percent of all Americans forecast to own an iPhone by 2016 . The first iPhone was notably different from other smartphones at the time because it used a large touchscreen for direct finger input , rather than the need for a stylus , keypad , or keyboard . The first templateYLabel[5] to use the Android OS was the HTC Dream released in 2008 . Although numbers of people using this OS were low at first , it has since grown to be the most used operating system , templateYLabel[3] an estimated 107.7 million Americans projected to own an Android templateYLabel[5] by 2016 .
