WTI is a relatively light crude templateTitle[5] , also called templateTitle[1] light sweet . It is used as a benchmark for templateTitle[5] pricing . Prices of templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] are often listed in templateTitle[5] templateYLabel[0] reports , alongside other important templateTitle[5] markers , like UK Brent or the OPEC basket . templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] crude templateTitle[5] WTI is a grade of crude templateTitle[5] also known as `` templateTitle[1] light sweet . '' It is measured to have an API gravity of around 39.6 and specific gravity of about 0.83 , which is considered `` light '' relative to other crude oils . This templateTitle[5] also contains roughly 0.24 percent sulfur , and is therefore named `` sweet . '' WTI is used as an templateTitle[5] pricing benchmark . WTI crude templateTitle[5] is also the underlying commodity of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange 's templateTitle[5] futures contracts . The templateYLabel[0] of other crude oils , such as UK Brent crude templateTitle[5] , the OPEC crude templateTitle[5] basket , and Dubai Fateh templateTitle[5] , can be compared to that of WTI crude templateTitle[5] . Since templateTitle[7] , the templateYLabel[0] of WTI crude templateTitle[5] has increased dramatically , rising from just 12.23 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in templateTitle[7] to a peak of 99.06 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in 2008 . The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in March 2016 was a monthly templateTitle[4] of 33.18 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] . The templateYLabel[0] of WTI is volatile , as a timeline of the monthly templateYLabel[0] development of templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] crude templateTitle[5] shows . The templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[5] is controlled in part by limiting templateTitle[5] production . Prior to 1971 , the templateTitle[1] Railroad Commission controlled the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[5] by setting limits on production of templateYLabel[2] templateTitle[5] . In 1971 , the templateTitle[1] Railroad Commission ceased limiting production , but OPEC , the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries with member states Iran , Iraq , Kuwait , Saudi Arabia , and Venezuela among others , continued to templateYLabel[3] so . In 1972 , due to geopolitical conflict , OPEC set an templateTitle[5] embargo and cut templateTitle[5] production , causing prices to quadruple by 1974 . templateTitle[5] prices rose again in 1979 and 1980 due to the Iranian revolution , and doubled between 1978 and 1981 as the Iran-Iraq War prevented templateTitle[5] production . A number of geopolitical conflicts and periods of increased production and consumption have influenced the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[5] since the 1980s .

Homicides in the United States The term templateYLabel[0] is used when a human being is killed by another human being . Criminal templateYLabel[0] takes several forms , templateTitle[2] example murder ; but templateYLabel[0] is not always a crime , it also includes affirmative defense , insanity , self-defense or the execution of convicted criminals . In 2018 , templateYLabel[0] in templateTitle[9] grew by about 2.74 percent on the templateYLabel[5] year.The recession-proof land down under templateYLabel[0] is one of the primary indicators used to gauge the state and health of a country 's economy . It is the total market value of all final goods and services that have been produced within a country in a given period of time , usually a templateXLabel[0] . templateYLabel[0] figures allow templateYLabel[5] to understand a country 's economy in a clear way . Real templateYLabel[0] , in a similar vein , is also a very useful indicator ; this is a measurement that takes prices changes ( inflation and deflation ) into account , therefore acting as a key indicator for economic templateYLabel[1] . The templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] templateTitle[2] ( templateYLabel[0] ) templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in templateTitle[9] has , for sometime , been able to get a steady foothold in the somewhat shaky post-recession world , shaky , but far from catastrophic . The annual templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] between the 2008 and 2009 financial years , for example , a time at which the world was brought to its proverbial knees , saw templateYLabel[1] rates down under reach to 2.49 and 1.37 percent respectively on the templateYLabel[5] years , whereas the templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] templateYLabel[2] in the United States plummeted well into the minus zone . templateTitle[9] , like all other capitalist nations , is at the mercy of international markets , and when the world economy takes a hit , it would be foolish to suggest it could emerge fully unscathed . However , templateTitle[9] has earned some much deserved praise and attention owing to the fact that it has managed to remain recession-free for the past twenty years . This could be thanks to its abundance of raw materials , the Australian mining boom , the fact the recession came at a time of high commodity prices and , maybe most importantly , that just under a third of its exports go to China .

The volume of templateTitle[0] energy-related carbon dioxide templateYLabel[1] has steadily risen over the last decade , from 28.7 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in 2009 to 33.3 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] templateYLabel[5] in templateTitle[8] . However , the rate of increase has slowed down in the last few years , but has still reached a historic high in the last templateXLabel[0] . From 2013 to 2016 , there had been evidence of a templateTitle[0] decoupling of greenhouse gas templateYLabel[1] from economic growth . It has been suggested that the immense addition of new renewable templateTitle[5] capacity has been critical for reducing templateYLabel[1] growth . In the recent past , a decrease or relatively unchanged volume of templateYLabel[1] has only been seen during economically weak periods , such as during the 2009 recession . Both the United States and China , two of the largest emitters in the world , registered a decrease in carbon dioxide templateYLabel[1] in 2015 . In China , a reduction in coal consumption has enabled an economic restructuring towards less energy-intensive industries and an emphasis on renewable resources . However , the decrease in templateYLabel[1] from these two countries was largely offset by other developing Asian countries and the Middle East , as well as increased templateYLabel[1] in Europe . The franchise first joined the league as an expansion team in 1995 and was located in Vancouver from its inauguration up to templateTitle[4] when it was relocated to templateTitle[0] . The team plays its home games at the FedExForum , which has a capacity of about templateTitle[6] thousand for basketball games . In the 2012/13 season , the average attendance at home games of the templateTitle[0] templateTitle[1] was 16,624 . The total attendance at these games over the course of the season was at 680 thousand . Tickets to templateTitle[1] games cost 30 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] on average in 2013/14 , more than templateTitle[4] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] below the league-wide average ticket price of 52.5 templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] . NBA games in templateTitle[0] were amongst the most affordable throughout the league with aforementioned ticket prices . In this period , Greece had the highest proportion of templateTitle[1] in the templateTitle[3] with 37 percent . Cigarette prices differ across templateTitle[3] : the most expensive templateXLabel[0] in which to purchase cigarettes is the United Kingdom ( UK ) . Cigarette prices in templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[0] driven templateTitle[6] the respective taxes imposed within each of the member states and consist of a specific duty per 1,000 cigarettes and an ad valorem rate onto the recommended retail price , in addition to value added tax ( VAT ) . Thus the highest rates of taxation templateYLabel[0] reflected in the retail prices . Similar rates of taxation between countries templateYLabel[0] also found for hand rolling tobacco , where the highest levels of taxation templateYLabel[0] found in the United Kingdom once again . Governments that impose such strong barriers to the purchasing of tobacco templateYLabel[0] considered 'nanny states ' _ , with high levels of control on other factors , such as advertising , bans of tobacco products on retail displays and graphic warnings on cigarette packs .

The statistic shows the templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[2] as of June templateTitle[8] , templateTitle[6] templateXLabel[0] . In the United Kingdom , 15 templateTitle[3] power templateYLabel[2] were in operation as of this time . templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[2] are those connected to the grid . templateYLabel[0] of templateTitle[2] templateTitle[3] power templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] templateXLabel[0] In 1954 , history was made when templateTitle[3] fission technology was approved for commercial purposes and the first templateTitle[3] power templateTitle[5] started operation in the Russian city of Obninsk . For the first time , it was possible to meet the demand of an increasingly energy-thirsty world – at a reasonable price , too . The new energy proved to be an extremely reliable and stable form of electricity . Since templateTitle[3] power templateTitle[5] are only shut down for refuelling every two years or so , they provide an around-the-clock `` baseload '' supply of power to the people . In templateTitle[3] fission , uranium atoms are split apart into lighter elements . Uranium is a radioactive metal that is extracted from mines , mainly in Kazakhstan , Canada and Australia . After the uranium splitting process , the used fuel elements are still radioactive and have to be stored in templateTitle[3] waste repositories or spent fuel pools . These sites are often underground and require thick metal or concrete walls to shield the public from radiation . In the past , several accidents at templateTitle[3] power templateTitle[5] - including Three Mile Island , Chernobyl and Fukushima -have shown just how dangerous radioactivity is , once it is released into the environment . Currently , there are 450 templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[2] in operation in some 30 countries around the world . One of the largest templateTitle[5] is situated in France , where about 70 percent of total electricity generation was derived from templateTitle[3] sources in 2018 . In 2011 , the alliance between General Electric and Hitachi was ranked as the third largest maker of templateTitle[3] templateYLabel[2] , behind France 's Areva and Russia-based Rosatom . The templateTitle[3] power templateTitle[5] market was sized at around 30 billion US dollars in 2011 , and is expected to exceed 50 billion US dollars templateTitle[6] 2030 . In 2050 , global templateTitle[3] power capacity is projected to reach 516 gigawatts .

The statistic reflects the seasonally adjusted templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in member states of the European Union in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] . The seasonally adjusted templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] in Spain in templateTitle[5] templateTitle[6] was 13.8 percent.The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] represents the share of the unemployed in all potential employees available to the job market . templateYLabel[0] rates in the templateTitle[3] The templateYLabel[0] templateYLabel[1] is an important measure of a templateXLabel[0] or region 's economic health , and despite templateYLabel[0] levels in the European Union falling slightly from a peak in early 2013 , they remain high , especially in comparison to what the rates were before the worldwide recession started in 2008 . This confirms the continuing stagnation in European markets , which hits young job seekers particularly hard as they struggle to compete against older , more experienced workers for a job , suffering under jobless rates twice as high as general templateYLabel[0] . Some companies , such as Microsoft and Fujitsu , have created thousands of jobs in some of the templateTitle[4] which have particularly dire templateYLabel[0] rates , creating a beacon of hope . However , some industries such as information technology , face the conundrum of a deficit of qualified workers in the local unemployed work force , and have to hire workers from abroad instead of helping decrease the local templateYLabel[0] rates . This skills mismatch has no quick solution , as workers require time for retraining to fill the openings in the growing science- , technology- , or engineering-based jobs , and too few students choose degrees that would help them obtain these positions . Worldwide templateYLabel[0] also remains high , with the rates being worst in the Middle East and North Africa . Estimates by the International Labour Organization predict that the problem will stabilize in coming years , but not improve until at least 2017 .

A country divided Since Trump 's inauguration in January 2017 , political camps in the United States templateYLabel[0] deeply divided and global templateTitle[4] is in turmoil ; Trump 's job approval ratings templateYLabel[0] notoriously low , and in fact , they templateYLabel[0] lower than Reagan 's or Nixon 's averages ever were . On the other side One of Trump 's main campaign promises was a wall on the border with Mexico in order to keep potential illegal immigrants out and enhance security for American citizens . When he did not get the majority for this plan , he declared a national emergency to force the budget to be allocated , even though the majority of Americans did not support this idea , and it is unclear if the situation at the Mexican border actually warrants it . In fact , the total number of unauthorized immigrants has decreased over the last few years and today , many Americans believe that their country benefits from immigrants and their work .

PepsiCoPepsiCo is an American food and beverage corporation , based in Purchase , NY . Famous company beverage brands include templateTitle[0] and Mountain Dew . templateTitle[0] has increased its global templateTitle[2] revenues from 39.47 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] in templateTitle[5] to 64.66 templateYLabel[2] templateYLabel[3] templateYLabel[4] in templateTitle[7] . Caleb Bradham developed the recipe for the templateTitle[0] soft drink in 1880 in North Carolina . As his drink became more popular , he established the Pepsi-Cola Company in 1902 . In 1965 , the Pepsi-Cola company merged with Frito-Lay Inc. , to form templateTitle[0] , Inc .. Currently , the company owns a variety of well known brands that with about 60 percent dedicated to food products and about 40 percent to drink products . templateTitle[0] is divided into four main divisions including Americas Foods , Americas Beverages , Europe , Asia and Middle East and Africa . As of 2014 , over half of the company templateTitle[1] revenues were generated from the templateTitle[0] Americas Foods and Americas Beverages , totaling 38 percent and 32 percent of global templateTitle[2] revenues , respectively . Many are familiar with the competition between templateTitle[0] and Coca-Cola , named the `` cola wars '' , but lately , both companies have started to depend on businesses outside of the beverage market . Recently , the industry is responding to changes in the market as the demand for carbonated soft drinks has decreased . However , studies have indicated that few people can discern the difference between the two soft drinks in a blind taste test , nevertheless , there have been indications that Coca-Cola has been more successful in its branding .

In contrast , New England states like Vermont , Maine , and New Hampshire had the most people identifying as nonreligious . A Christian nation ? Catholicism has the largest number of adherents in the United States , due to there being many different Protestant denominations . The Southern Baptist Convention had the largest number of Evangelical adherents , while the United Methodist templateTitle[0] was the largest Mainline Protestant denomination .
